* Represent the copyright screening team in internal and external meetings, acting as the primary point of contact for communication with external partners
* Quality assurance and compliance – Ensure copyright screening processes adhere to internal policies, industry regulations, and best practices, maintaining high-quality standards


**Requirements:**
 We’re looking for a driven and detail-oriented leader who thrives in an operational role, balancing strategic oversight with hands-on execution. You are highly organized, data-savvy, and skilled at managing people and processes. While a passion for music is not required, an interest in digital rights management (DRM) and music business is a plus.
   

  

* Proven Leadership Experience – Strong background in managing and developing teams, preferably large and/or remote teams
* Operational & Scheduling Expertise – Experience handling scheduling, task management, and workflow optimization to ensure efficiency and scalability
* Hiring & Talent Development – Hands-on experience in recruitment, onboarding, and providing structured feedback for team growth
* Data-Driven Mindset – Comfortable collecting, analyzing, and leveraging data to inform decision-making and drive continuous improvement
* Strong Communication Skills – Excellent written and verbal communication in English, with the ability to present insights clearly and engage effectively with both internal and external stakeholders
* Comfortable working with digital tools and platforms; experience with content management systems (for example YouTube’s CMS) is a plus
* DRM & Music Rights Knowledge – Understanding of digital rights management and music rights is a plus


**Equal opportunity employer**
 We believe that bringing people together from different backgrounds, experiences and perspectives makes for a healthy workplace, a more successful business and a better world. We value diversity and encourage everyone to come and soundtrack the world with us.
   

  

**Application**
 Ready to make the world feel your work? Please apply, in English, by clicking the link “interested” below.
   

  

**Join our global force of 500+ innovators, blending the latest in tech with the greatest in soundtracking, from our Stockholm HQ to offices in London, New York, Los Angeles, Berlin, Oslo, and Seoul. We’re an industry leader with a startup mentality. We take what we do seriously, but we don’t take ourselves too seriously. Creating and collaborating to transform the sound of streaming, content, and culture. Come join us—and let the world feel your work.**

title: Social Media Manager / Content Strategist
description:
**Who we are:** 




 We are Kurppa Hosk Communications, a creative business partner building unforgettable brands in the new age of communication. From large-scale global concepts to niche, thumb-stopping posts, we craft stories that engage and resonate with our clients’ most desirable audiences.
   

  





**The opportunity:** 




 A magical gate just opened for a breathtakingly talented Social Media Manager/Content Strategist to join the Kurppa Hosk Communications family in Stockholm.
 



 The role is a
 **temporary project employment for 12 months** 
 , with possible extension to permanent employment, starting as organic social channel lead for one of our largest clients.
 



 As a Content Strategist at Kurppa Hosk Communications, you’ll be responsible for running and developing some of our great clients’ presence in social media.
   

 Your role includes a fair bit of staying up-to-date with the latest trends in the social media space, as well as playing a key role in both the strategic and creative processes.
   

**What you’ll do:** 



* Take care of and nurture some of our biggest brands in social media
* Build, develop and execute social media strategies on new or existing social media platforms
* Assist with integrating content strategy and brand campaigns to drive campaign goals
* Monitor the community and feedback insights into the creative process
* Work closely with our team of Art Directors, Copywriters, Designers and Project Managers on a daily basis to craft inspiring work and push the client’s brand forward
* Analyze social performance and act upon core findings
* Follow-up on analysis and optimize content
* Plan and publish content
* Play an essential role in client meetings
* Confidently present your findings, ideas and results



**What we're looking for:**



* Minimum of 3 years of experience in a similar role, ideally from a large organization
* Deep knowledge of organic social media plattforms, such as META, YouTube, LinkedIn and TikTok
* Experience of leading a team
* Experience in using AI-tools
* A person fluent in Swedish and English, ready to travel within Sweden on a monthly basis



**What’s in it for you:** 




 We offer a place in a highly creative and collaborative team with exciting projects. Our office is located at Grev Tureplan, where we sit together with all other Eidra companies based in Stockholm. 
 



 Eidra believes in helping people grow. Therefore, we have an ambitious self-development agenda. Every employee is assigned a coach, and peer-to-peer feedback is a part of every project. We also offer various courses for self-development and to deepen your knowledge in, for example, AI and strategy.
   

**Benefits:** 



* 30 days vacation
* 5000 kr wellness allowance
* Private health insurance
* ITP occupational pension



 This application is open until 19 March, 2025.

title: Digital Marketing Manager
company_industry: Technology, Information and Internet, IT Services and IT Consulting, and Computer and Network Security
description:
Meet
 
 Yubico
 
 : the inventor of the
 
 YubiKey
 
 ––the world's first and leading security key. Our company’s mission is to make secure login easy and available for everyone. Yubico was founded in 2007 by Stina and Jakob Ehrensvard, and recently went public on Nasdaq Stockholm Main Market: YUBICO. Our customers include Fortune 500 companies, hundreds of government agencies and millions of individuals in over 160 countries that rely on Yubico technology to secure access to computers, online services and mobile apps. We  are a global company with a strong company culture and employees located in over 14 countries. Yubico’s  headquarters are based in  Stockholm, Sweden and Santa Clara, CA.  Aligned with our mission to make the internet more secure for everyone, Yubico donates YubiKeys to organizations helping at-risk individuals through our philanthropic initiative,
 
 Secure it Forward
 
 .
 








**At Yubico, we offer:**








**Yubico Values:
 
 We work to ensure that our employees have an open space to have their voices amplified to create a workplace where everyone feels like they belong. Aligned with this, our employees have created some pretty cool Employee Resource Groups: YubiPride, YubiBIPOC, YubiSustainability and YubiWomen. Additionally, Yubico donates YubiKeys to organizations in need all over the world (you can read more about our work here).
 





**Social Connection:**

 Relationships and connectedness matter, and we love spending time with our team! Our virtual workspace keeps us connected day-to-day whether it's through Yubico celebrating wins or our buzzing Slack communities. We host an all-team event in a new location every year where we plan for upcoming quarters, set goals, and most importantly, host fun events to encourage team building outside of the workplace. Check out our
 

 Life at Yubico Page
 

 on LinkedIn and our awards
 

 here
 
**.**




  





**The Role:
 





 We are seeking an experienced Digital Marketing Manager to support the development and execution of our digital marketing strategy, driving growth and optimizing performance across various paid media channels. This role requires a knowledgeable professional with expertise in paid media platforms and best practices for B2B and B2C digital marketing. The ideal candidate is data-driven and creative, with the ability to manage campaigns, analyze performance metrics, and contribute to continuous improvement toward goals aligned with our business objectives.
 





  




**Tasks & Responsibilities:** 
* Assist in developing and implementing a multi-channel paid digital marketing strategy to drive awareness, lead generation, and customer acquisition and retention
* Collaborate on the creation and management of a paid digital marketing roadmap, ensuring alignment with cross-functional stakeholders and company goals
* Manage and execute paid digital marketing campaigns, including paid search, paid social, display, video, and other programmatic advertising channels to ensure a high return on investment (ROI)
* Measure and report on the performance of paid digital marketing campaigns using data analytics tools (e.g., Google Analytics, Looker, Salesforce)
* Analyze data and trends to improve digital marketing effectiveness and efficiency
* Provide insights and reports to cross-functional teams on key metrics and campaign performance
* Work closely with cross-functional teams, including product marketing, creative, SEO, operations, and sales to ensure cohesive marketing efforts
* Identify new paid digital marketing opportunities to enhance customer engagement and acquisition



  




**Basic Qualifications:** 
* 3-5 years of experience in digital marketing in both B2B and E-commerce
* Proven ability to support and execute paid digital marketing campaigns
* Experience managing budgets across multiple digital channels
* Strong understanding of SEM, social media advertising, and their roles within broader digital marketing strategies
* Proficiency in digital marketing tools such as Google Analytics, Google Ads, Facebook Ads Manager, LinkedIn Business Manager, and similar platforms
* Strong analytical skills with the ability to interpret data and make informed decisions
* Excellent written and verbal communication skills
* Solid project management skills






  




  














  





 We are an equal opportunity employer, we value diversity and uphold an inclusive environment where all people feel that they are equally respected and valued. All applicants will be considered for employment without attention to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, marital status, religion, national origin, disability, protected Veteran status or any other characteristic protected by law. We'd love to learn about what you can add to our diverse team.
 







 Yubico does not accept agency resumes or referrals so please do not send them to our careers staff or employees. Yubico is not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes or referrals.
 







 Personal data submitted through this form is used for managing Yubico’s recruitment activities, which include facilitating any application you make, setting up and conducting interviews and tests for applicants, evaluating and assessing results and selecting candidates, and as otherwise needed in our recruitment and onboarding processes. The use of your personal data may also be necessary prior to entering into a contract with you (that is prior to offering you a job with Yubico). Your personal data will only be used for the purposes for which it was collected and in accordance with the Yubico Privacy Notice. We only keep your personal data for as long as necessary and in compliance with Yubico’s record retention policies. If you have asked us to, we will keep you informed of other opportunities at Yubico. We do this in various ways, including email and by phone. If at any time you do not want us to contact you or use your information as described herein please contact us at jobs@yubico.com to let us know and we will delete all such information. Providing your personal data is voluntary, but necessary to join our talent community, and if you do not agree to provide your data, we will not be able to consider you as part of our talent community.
 







 As part of providing the requested service, we will transfer your data to be processed by Lever, Inc., a service provider contracted by Yubico AB and/or its subsidiaries that meets legally mandated privacy requirements. The Yubico Privacy Notice offers more information about Yubico privacy practices, including the lawful basis for processing of personal data, how to lodge a complaint with the supervisory authority, and how to contact Yubico to exercise your data subject rights. In this notice, when we refer to "Yubico", "us", "we" or "our", we mean the Yubico group company or companies that you apply to, or correspond with, and which are responsible for any personal data collected about you.****

title: (Senior) Integration Solution Architect – based in Luxembourg
description:
**This position is based at our Luxembourg headquarters and requires regular office presence.** 
 The EIB offers you the opportunity to live and work in a truly international and multi-cultural environment. We also offer relocation support.
   

  

 The
 **EIB** 
 , the European Union's bank, is seeking to recruit for its Group Corporate Services Directorate – Group Digital Office (GCS-GDO), Platforms & Services Department (P&S), Integration Division (INT) at its headquarters in Luxembourg, a
 **(Senior) Integration Solution Architect** 
**\*.**
**This is a full-time position at grade 5/6 for which the EIB offers a permanent contract.**
*\*Internal benchmark (Senior) Officer IT Applications*
***Panel interviews are anticipated for November 2024***
 Purpose
   

  

 You will join our dynamic team to design and implement cutting-edge integration solutions. In this role, you will be the Architect of innovation, weaving together complex systems into seamless, efficient, and effective solutions, while evolving our Integration platforms to meet the highest architectural standards and best practices.
   

  

 Look no further – your next career opportunity awaits!
   

  

 Operating Network
   

  

 The primary role of the Integration Division is to provide well-designed and well-run integration platforms, working as a force multiplier for application teams and citizen developers, delivering standards, well-proven practices, services and solutions, enabling application teams and citizen developers to do the right things in the right way with substantial autonomy.
   

  

 As an Integration Solution Architect, you will be responsible for designing and implementing integration solutions that connect disparate systems, applications, and data sources. You will collaborate closely with cross-functional teams to understand business requirements, assess existing architectures, and develop comprehensive integration strategies. This role requires a blend of technical expertise, strategic thinking, and excellent communication skills.
   

  

 This is a pivotal role directly reporting to the Head of Division.
   

  

 You will work in close collaboration with various IT teams and internal stakeholders. You will have privilege connections with the Enterprise Architecture Team.
   

  

 Accountabilities
   

  

* Design end-to-end Integration solutions to meet specific user needs and ensure compliance with the Enterprise Architecture Standards, IT Security Policies, and industry best practices.
* Collaborate with stakeholders to gather and analyze integration requirements.
* Assess existing systems and identify opportunities for integration and improvement.
* Develop architectural designs, data models, and integration patterns.
* Define, together with Enterprise Architecture, standards, guidelines and best practices for integration development.
* Provide guidance and support to application teams throughout the integration lifecycle.
* Evolve the Integration Platforms in accordance with Enterprise Architecture guidelines and industry standards to ensure its long-term cost-effectiveness, Business value, usability, efficiency, maintainability, and scalability.
* Communicate the solution architecture vision to the team and provide supervision and guidance throughout the development process to ensure high-quality solutions.
* Conduct presentations and coaching for other IT Teams to facilitate adoption and efficient use of new Integration standards and technologies.
* Follow new market trends and propose innovative approaches to maximise IT’s contribution to the Business, initiating and contributing to IT-wide initiatives in the field of Integration.
* Manage projects to ensure solution delivery within the set schedule, budget and quality objectives, as also keep the stakeholders informed on the progress, timing and budget of the projects.
* Coordinate with other IT teams in the context of their IT projects, provide effort and cost estimates for IT Integration contribution to the projects and supervise the execution of tasks assigned to IT Integration.


**Qualifications**
* University degree (minimum an equivalent to a Bachelor) preferably in Engineering, Information Technology, Information Management or related field.
* Proven experience as an Integration Solution Architect or similar role.
* At least 5 years’ relevant professional experience of design and implementation of software Solutions.
* Proven experience and excellent technical knowledge of the tools and architecture of the Integration stack, including API Management, Event Streaming, Enterprise Service Bus. Data Virtualization, message-oriented middleware, SOA and microservice enabling technologies would be an asset.
* Broad and deep experience working in varied software development platforms and environments such as Java, Python, JavaScript, vendor packages, and Tomcat/JBoss.
* Hands-on experience with web services, RESTful APIs, XML, JSON, and other integration protocols
* Familiarity with cloud platforms such as AWS, Azure, or Google Cloud.
* Knowledge of security aspects of integrated system design and associated protocols, including token-based authorization and encryption.
* Excellent knowledge of English and/or French (\*\*), with a good command of the other. Knowledge of other EU languages would be an advantage.


 Competencies
   

  

*Find out more about EIB core competencies* 
 here
   

  

*(\*\*) Unless stated explicitly as a required qualification, a good command of French is not a pre-requisite for hire. As both English and French are however official working languages of the EIB, proficiency in both languages is a pre-requisite for your future career development. Any language clause in your contract must be fulfilled in order for you to be eligible for a promotion (either via the annual appraisal cycle or via an internal selection process). Proficiency is understood to mean the attainment of* 
*level 5 of the Inter Institutional language courses, corresponding to B1.2 of the Common European Framework of Reference for Languages (CEFRL). The Bank offers appropriate training support.*
 We are an equal opportunities employer, who believes that diversity is good for our people and our business. We encourage all suitably qualified and eligible candidates to apply regardless of their gender identity/expression, age, racial, ethnic and cultural background, religion and beliefs, sexual orientation/identity, disability or neurodiversity.
   

  

 To find out more about our eligibility criteria click here
   

  

 Applicants with specific needs are encouraged to request reasonable accommodations at any stage during the recruitment process. Please contact the EIB Recruitment team Jobs@eib.org who will ensure that your request is handled.
   

  

 By applying for this position, you acknowledge the importance of maintaining the security and integrity of the Information of the EIB Group. In case of selection for the position you agree to comply with all measures (policies, controls, document classification and management) implemented by the EIB Group to prevent unauthorised disclosure of any information or any damage to the EIB Group reputation.
   

  

**This is an open campaign to consecutively fill open positions. The campaign will remain open until position is filled. Applications will be reviewed in order of receipt.**

title: Chief Product Officer
description:
*Founded in 2018, Kreditz is already the market leader in Next-Gen credit scoring products, and the 168th fastest-growing start-up in Europe according to Sifted (Sifted 250 European Leaderboard December 2024).*
*We use Open Banking/PSD2 technology to create our revolutionizing real-time credit scoring products, which are beloved by banks, financial institutions, gambling companies and many more. Kreditz products enable consumers, and businesses, to gain financial inclusion, and financial opportunity where none would be available with traditional credit scoring systems.*
*Our long-term vision "One world, One score" translates into our everyday mission of financial inclusion, and financial opportunity, for everyone around the globe
   

  

 – Everyone deserves a fair assessment.*
*To fuel our growth to the next level, we recently added 10m EUR of funding from world renown investors Creades and Ingka Investments.*
*Come join us on our impactful mission!*
**About The Position**
 Thanks to a continuous three-figure growth (+145% from FY22 to FY24) and exciting expansion plans, we are looking to strengthen our organization further with a CPO who will continue to champion Kreditz’s innovative Next-gen credit scoring solutions and bring them closer to the hearts and lives of our customers. This is an opportunity to embrace our founder’s original vision and elevate our products to always be ‘next level’ fintech solutions that the market has been waiting for. We are currently entering an exciting phase (startup to scaleup) and expanding our market presence rapidly in the Nordic countries and in Europe. Our clients range from some of Europe’s largest banks and iGaming companies to smaller, innovative businesses.
   

  

 As CPO at Kreditz, you will be a key member of our executive leadership team, responsible for shaping and executing our product vision and strategy. You will work closely with the CEO, CTO, CAO (current product owners) and take advantage of all Kreditz functions to ensure customer-centric, viable products that the market can’t be without.
   

  

**What Can Kreditz Offer**
* The opportunity to create a meaningful difference in the future of finance through Kreditz
* One-way ticket to an amazing growth journey you will never forget – A journey where everyone in the team plays a crucial role for our company’s success
* Fun-loving, dedicated, and talented colleagues with whom to share small and big company, and personal, milestones and accomplishments
* Humble corporate culture – we celebrate all wins, no matter the size, together!
* 24/7 access to gym/sauna/sports center at our office PLUS additional wellness allowance
* Competitive salary + Option incentive


**Responsibilities**
 Some of the main responsibilities you will cover:
   

  

* Share and share a clear product vision and strategy aligned with the company’s overall vision, goals and market trends
* Define and prioritize the product roadmap, ensuring it aligns with customer needs, market opportunities and business objectives
* Advocate for a customer-first mindset in product development, leveraging customer feedback and data to drive decision-making; you are an expert in knowing who your customer is and what problems you are solving
* Staying up-to-date with industry trends, competitor offerings, and regulatory changes to identify opportunities and threats
* Oversee end-to-end product development, from concept/mockup to launch, ensuring high-quality and timely delivery of new products and features
* Foster close collaboration with cross-functional teams, including: Analytics, IT, Sales and Operations to ensure successful product launches and ongoing product care
* Prioritize user experience and design excellence to create products that are not only functional but also intuitive and aesthetically pleasing
* Embrace data analytics and insights to make informed product decisions and measure product performance OKRs


**WE ARE LOOKING FOR**
 An inspiring and hands-on Chief Product Officer to guide our strategy, foster innovation, and champion global growth. If you thrive on creating transformative fintech products and meet the following qualities, we want to hear from you.
   

  

* 7+ years in product leadership with a strong track record of launching and scaling products (FinTech, Credit Scoring Solutions or related fields preferred)
* 3+ years building and managing cross-functional teams, fostering collaboration and high performance
* A customer-first and data-driven approach using insights and metrics to guide product decisions
* Proven agility in fast-paced environments, balancing strategic thinking with execution
* Deep understanding of fintech and credit scoring industry trends, regulations, and customer preferences
* Culture champion: Aligns with Kreditz values of integrity, curiosity, and innovation
* Bachelor’s degree (or equivalent) in a relevant field
* Inspiring leadership and team-building skills
* Communication skills in both Swedish and English (verbal and written).


*It´s a plus if you have*
* Previous experience from startup organization going scaleup is meritorious
* Previous experience from fintech/Open Banking/Credit Scoring products is very meritorious


**APPOINTMENT OF ROLE**
 Starting date Q1/Q2 2025
   

  

**SCOPE**
 Full-time, permanent employment (tillsvidareanställning)
   

  

**SALARY**
 Fixed monthly salary + Option incentive
   

  

**REPORTING**
 You will be reporting to the company’s CEO
   

  

**WORKPLACE**
 Our brand-new office is in Danderyd, Stockholm
   

  

**RECRUITMENT PROCESS**
 We interview candidates on an ongoing basis (ongoing selection).
   

  

**CONTACT**
 Lorenzo Puccio, COO, Lorenzo@kreditz.com
   

  

 For more information about the role feel free to reach out to our CEO/Founder roni@kreditz.com

title: Consultancy: UPSHIFT Communications Consultant, Office of Innovation, Stockholm, Sweden, 12 months (Remote)
description:
UNICEF works in some of the world’s toughest places, to reach the world’s most disadvantaged children. To save their lives. To defend their rights. To help them fulfill their potential.
   

  

 Across 190 countries and territories, we work for every child, everywhere, every day, to build a better world for everyone.
   

  

 And we never give up.
   

  

**For every child...innovate**
 UNICEF has a 70-year history of innovating for children. We believe that new approaches, partnerships and technologies that support realizing children’s rights are critical to improving their lives.
   

  

 The
 **Office of Innovation** 
 is a creative, interactive, and agile team in UNICEF. We sit at a unique intersection, where an organization that works on huge global issues meets the start-up thinking, the technology, and the partners that turn this energy into scalable solutions.
   

  

 As the custodian of the UPSHIFT the Office of Innovation (OoI) continues to engage daily with country offices implementing UPSHIFT and is developing subsequent tools, knowledge products and lessons learned to further support the UPSHIFT community of practice accelerate the delivery of results for children and young people globally.
   

  

**About UPSHIFT**
 UPSHIFT is a UNICEF global skills development solution. It draws from best practices from non-formal education, experiential learning, and business education to create a learning journey that consists of workshops, mentorship, and an entrepreneurial challenge. Participants learn how to identify and analyze problems that they care deeply about and how to create products or services that address them. At the end of the 25 hours course (phase I), all the solutions are evaluated, and the most promising ones receive seed funding and further mentoring and learning support for their implementation (Phase II). This encourages young people to keep coming up with big ideas as they can see the selected ones become reality.
   

  

 UPSHIFT is currently operating in 56 countries with 5 million young people having completed over 120 million learning hours since UPSHIFT started in 2014 with one million young people having finished a full UPSHIFT learning journey in 2024 alone.
   

  

**How can you make a difference?**
 With UPSHIFT scaling rapidly across 56 countries there is a need to develop strong communication assets, campaigns to document it’s results to date, including the integration of its delivery into education systems across 12 countries with more expected to follow suit in 2025. To this end, the Office of Innovation is seeking a communication consultant to lead to work in close collaboration with the Partnerships and Communication team as well as with Country Offices, Regional Offices to assist in planning, development and creation of UPSHIFT advocacy and communication materials and systems.
   

  

**Your Main Responsibilities Will Be**
* Produce editorial content (e.g. articles, press releases, human interest stories and other advocacy/information materials) for both web-based and traditional media, as appropriate.
* Follow up on the production of advocacy and communication materials (e.g., films, videos, audio-visuals, etc.), and oversee the qualitative aspects of production (e.g., quality control, translations, reviews of layout and graphic design etc.).
* Work closely with the UPSHIFT Global lead to update the SharePoint deployment toolkit.
* Work closely with the UPSHIFT Global lead and OoI communications team to identify opportunities to showcase UPSHIFT in OoI / UNICEF events.
* Maintain and regularly update the existing communication asset data base (HIS, Videos, Sites) and develop database of additional communication assets including social media assets, publications referencing UPSHIFT, press releases and clippings, photographs, audio-visual materials, web resources, etc.
* Develop template to document most successful projects developed by Upshifters and work with country offices to document the top 50 such projects.
* Recommend appropriate information and communication materials for use in media and other advocacy and communication activities.
* Perform other content development duties, as well as other communication officer duties as assigned by the Supervisor.


 For more information, please review the ToR: ToR - UPSHIFT Communications Consultant\_Final.docx
   

  

**To qualify as an advocate for every child you will have…**
* An advanced university degree (master’s or higher) in education, information technology, or another relevant field.
* A first University Degree in a relevant field combined with 2 additional years of professional experience may be accepted in lieu of an Advanced University Degree.
* A minimum of 5 years of relevant work experience in communication, content creation, editorial planning and social media management, including planning and implementation.
* Proven ability to write engaging, flawless copy for media on tight deadlines in English including web content.
* Strong interpersonal skills in being able to develop and maintain effective working relations with a diverse range of stakeholders.
* Ability to work independently, be proactive and possess strong organizational skills, with good attention to detail.
* Proven experience in developing engaging visual design assets including presentation decks, infographics and documents.
* Demonstrated experience in supporting and/or managing projects to completion, including developing and implementing clear processes.
* Experience in leading the development and implementation of communication campaigns is an asset.
* Knowledge of children’s rights, public policy, international development and humanitarian issues is an asset.
* Fluency in English is required. Knowledge of another official UN language (Arabic, Chinese, French, Russian or Spanish) or a local language is an asset.


**Travel**
* The consultant is not expected to travel through the duration of the assignment


**Payment details and further considerations**
* Payment of professional fees will be based on the submission of agreed deliverables. UNICEF reserves the right to withhold payment in case the deliverables submitted are not up to the required standard or in case of delays in submitting the deliverables on the part of the consultant.


**How To Apply**
* Interest applicant is required to submit a financial proposal with all-inclusive fee. Please see the financial proposal template.
* Financial proposal must include travel costs (economy class) and daily subsistence allowance, if travel is required as per TOR and any other estimated costs: visa, travel/health insurance
* Applications without a financial proposal will not be considered. Consultancy Financial Offer template.docx


**General Terms And Conditions**
 Please review UNICEF's General Terms and Conditions for Consultants here for important information regarding contract obligations, including medical insurance, SARS-CoV-2 (Covid-19) vaccination, and income tax requirements.
   

  

**For every Child, you demonstrate…**
 UNICEF's values of Care, Respect, Integrity, Trust, Accountability, and Sustainability (CRITAS).
   

  

 To view our competency framework, please visit  here.
   

  

 UNICEF is committed to diversity and inclusion within its workforce, and encourages all candidates, irrespective of gender, nationality, religious or ethnic background, and persons with disabilities, to apply to become a part of the organization. To create a more inclusive workplace, UNICEF offers paid parental leave, breastfeeding breaks, and reasonable accommodation for persons with disabilities. UNICEF strongly encourages the use of flexible working arrangements. Click here to learn more about flexible work arrangements, well-being, and benefits.
   

  

 According to the UN Convention on the Rights of Persons with Disabilities (UNCRPD), persons with disabilities include those who have long-term physical, mental, intellectual, or sensory impairments which, in interaction with various barriers, may hinder their full and effective participation in society on an equal basis with others. In its Disability Inclusion Policy and Strategy 2022-2030, UNICEF has committed to increase the number of employees with disabilities by 2030. At UNICEF, we provide reasonable accommodation for work-related support requirements of candidates and employees with disabilities. Also, UNICEF has launched a Global Accessibility Helpdesk to strengthen physical and digital accessibility. If you are an applicant with a disability who needs digital accessibility support in completing the online application, please submit your request through the accessibility email button on the UNICEF Careers webpage Accessibility | UNICEF.
   

  

 UNICEF does not hire candidates who are married to children (persons under 18). UNICEF has a zero-tolerance policy on conduct that is incompatible with the aims and objectives of the United Nations and UNICEF, including sexual exploitation and abuse, sexual harassment, abuse of authority and discrimination based on gender, nationality, age, race, sexual orientation, religious or ethnic background or disabilities. UNICEF is committed to promote the protection and safeguarding of all children. All selected candidates will, therefore, undergo rigorous reference and background checks, and will be expected to adhere to these standards and principles. Background checks will include the verification of academic credential(s) and employment history. Selected candidates may be required to provide additional information to conduct a background check, and selected candidates with disabilities may be requested to submit supporting documentation in relation to their disability confidentially.
   

  

**Remarks**
 Only shortlisted candidates will be contacted and advance to the next stage of the selection process.
   

  

 Individuals engaged under a consultancy or individual contract will not be considered “staff members” under the Staff Regulations and Rules of the United Nations and UNICEF’s policies and procedures and will not be entitled to benefits provided therein (such as leave entitlements and medical insurance coverage). Their conditions of service will be governed by their contract and the General Conditions of Contracts for the Services of Consultants and Individual Contractors. Consultants and individual contractors are responsible for determining their tax liabilities and for the payment of any taxes and/or duties, in accordance with local or other applicable laws.
   

  

 The selected candidate is solely responsible to ensure that the visa (applicable) and health insurance required to perform the duties of the contract are valid for the entire period of the contract. Selected candidates are subject to confirmation of fully vaccinated status against SARS-CoV-2 (Covid-19) with a World Health Organization (WHO)-endorsed vaccine, which must be met prior to taking up the assignment. It does not apply to consultants who will work remotely and are not expected to work on or visit UNICEF premises, programme delivery locations or directly interact with communities UNICEF works with, nor to travel to perform functions for UNICEF for the duration of their consultancy contracts.

title: Lösningsarkitekt med fokus på SAP och kampanjhantering - Coop Sverige
description:
***Lösningsarkitekt med fokus på SAP och kampanjhantering - Coop Sverige***




  





**Ansök senast:** 
 23 mars 2025
 



**Placering:** 
 Solna
 



  





 På Coop Sverige förstår vi att moderna IT-lösningar och datadrivna arbetssätt är nyckeln till framgång. Vi är på en spännande transformationsresa och söker nu en lösningsarkitekt med fokus på SAP och kampanjhantering som vill hjälpa oss att ta nästa steg mot en grönare och mer hållbar framtid.
 



  





 Du kommer att vara en viktig nyckelspelare i utvecklingen av våra IT-lösningar, där kampanjhantering och SAP-plattformen kommer att vara ditt fokusområde. Har du djup teknisk kompetens och erfarenhet av att arbeta med komplexa systemmiljöer, är detta rollen för dig.
 



  





 I rollen som lösningsarkitekt ansvarar du för att designa och implementera hållbara IT-lösningar som stödjer vår kampanjhantering och övriga affärsprocesser. Du fungerar som rådgivare till verksamheten, stödjer utvecklingsteam och bidrar till att översätta affärskrav till tekniska lösningar som skapar värde. Tillsammans med andra lösningsarkitekter, enterprise-arkitekter och utvecklingsteam skapar vi robusta IT-lösningar som stödjer Coops affärsmål.
 



  





**Huvudsakliga arbetsuppgifter:** 



* Designa lösningar inom SAP och kring system med särskilt med fokus på kampanjhantering och relaterade processer.
* Säkerställa att Coops målarkitektur följer våra beslutade arkitekturprinciper för skalbarhet, säkerhet och hållbarhet.
* Säkerställa god prestanda i relation till UDF och arbetssätt i PM.
* Stötta verksamheten i att översätta krav till tekniska lösningar och förstå påverkan på övergripande arkitektur.
* Arbeta tvärfunktionellt för att skapa effektiva integrationslösningar mellan SAP och andra system som POS och CRM.
* Delta i utvecklingsprojekt och driva frågeställningar inom arkitektur och lösningar.
* Bidra till ett datadrivet arbetssätt genom att optimera datamodellering och rapportering.
* Fungera som en brygga mellan IT och verksamheten för att skapa samsyn och stöd i beslutsfattande.



  





 Tjänsten är tillsvidare med 6 månaders provanställning med start enligt överenskommelse.
 



  





**Kvalifikationer** 




**Vi söker dig som har:** 




 • Erfarenhet av SAP S4-plattformen: Kunskap om SAP CAR-moduler som PMR (Promotion Management for Retail) och integrationer med andra affärssystem.
 



 • Systemkompetens inom kampanjhantering: Erfarenhet av att implementera systemstöd för kampanjer, prisoptimering och kundsegmentering.
 



 • Teknisk expertis: Stark kompetens inom IT-infrastruktur, datamodellering och systemutveckling i komplexa miljöer.
 



 • Förståelse för detaljhandeln: Erfarenhet av affärsprocesser inom detaljhandeln, med fokus på säljcykler och kundbeteende.
 



 • Projektvana: Erfarenhet av att arbeta i tvärfunktionella projekt och använda verktyg som JIRA eller SAP Solution Manager.
 



 • Kommunikativ förmåga: Förmåga att förklara komplexa tekniska koncept på ett begripligt sätt, på både svenska och engelska.
 



 • Agil erfarenhet: Erfarenhet av att arbeta enligt agila principer är meriterande.
 



 • Erfarenhet från LeanIX eller annat arkitekturverktyg.
 



 • Utbildning: En relevant examen eller motsvarande arbetslivserfarenhet. Certifieringar inom SAP är ett stort plus.
 



  





**Om Coop:** 




 Dagligvaruhandeln är en stabil och samhällsviktig bransch. Coop med fyra miljoner medlemmar finns över hela landet och är en viktig del i omställningen mot en grönare och mer hållbar framtid.
 



  





 Du kommer att vara del av en företagskultur präglad prestigelöshet, initiativförmåga och starka värderingar. Vi tar gemensamt ansvar och har en stark vilja att hjälpa varandra att lyckas. Vårt kontor i Solna erbjuder en modern och bra arbetsmiljö med en fantastisk personalrestaurang. På Coop arbetar vi för våra 4 miljoner medlemmar och är därmed Sveriges i särklass största kooperation.
 



  





 Har du frågor om tjänsten är du välkommen att höra av dig till Nicklas Hinders. Kontaktuppgifter finner du längre ner på sidan.
 



  





 För att rättvist matcha kandidater med de krav som rollen ställer kommer vi att använda tester under urvalsarbetet.
 



  





 Coop värdesätter kvaliteter som en jämn ålders- och könsfördelning samt etnisk och kulturell mångfald tillför verksamheten.
 



  





 Välkommen med din ansökan så snart som möjligt då vi jobbar löpande med urval och intervjuer!
 



  





**Om företaget** 




 Coop är en av Sveriges största arbetsgivare och vi drivs av uppgiften att ge alla tillgång till den goda maten. Vi är inne i en spännande förändringsresa mot att vara den
 *goda kraften i mat-Sverige* 
 . Vi ska förenkla vardagen och ge alla tillgång till goda råvaror – något som är bra för både kropp, själ och vår miljö.
 



  





 Tillsammans med våra medarbetare arbetar vi varje dag tillsammans med våra kunder för att fortsätta vara bäst på hållbar utveckling och nu satsar vi ännu mer på att sprida matglädje och mer kärlek till bra råvaror.
 



  





 Vi värdesätter kvaliteter som en jämn ålders- och könsfördelning samt etnisk och kulturell mångfald tillför verksamheten.
 



  





**Kontaktperson** 




 Nicklas Hinders
 



 nicklas.hinders@coop.se

title: Linklaters söker jurister till M&A och Private equity med start i september 2025
description:
**Om oss**
 Linklaters är en internationell ledande affärsjuridisk advokatbyrå med huvudkontor i London. Med över 5600 anställda och 31 kontor är vi etablerade i alla stora affärs- och finanscentra och kan erbjuda våra klienter förstklassig juridisk rådgivning världen över.
   

  

 Vårt Stockholmskontor fokuserar på komplex transaktionsrådgivning inom M&A, Private equity och Banking & Finance och arbetar integrerat med Linklaters övriga kontor världen över. Hos oss utvecklar du din affärsjuridiska kompetens och bygger ett starkt lokalt och internationellt nätverk, samtidigt som du bistår våra klienter i deras mest komplexa transaktioner och ärenden. Läs mer om Linklaters på www.linklaters.com.
   

  

**Arbetsbeskrivning**
 Just nu söker vi dig som är nyexaminerad jurist och vill arbeta med M&A och Private equity. Du har utmärkta juridiska kunskaper, starka akademiska meriter och vill arbeta i team på en internationell byrå med tydligt transaktionsfokus. Du har mycket goda kunskaper i svenska och engelska. Servicekänsla, noggrannhet och god analytisk förmåga är också av stor vikt. Du är en positiv och öppen person som är intresserad av att lära dig och av att bidra till både verksamhetens och din personliga utveckling.
   

  

**Vårt erbjudande**
 Du erbjuds en spännande tjänst på en internationell ledande advokatbyrå där det finns stora möjligheter till utveckling. Du får dagligen arbeta i en internationell miljö med topprankade jurister och marknadens mest komplexa ärenden, både i Stockholm och runt om i världen. Vi är en innovativ byrå och det finns möjligheter att utvecklas och engagera sig inom många olika områden såsom Legal Tech, ESG och CSR.
   

  

 Linklaters erbjuder generösa anställningsförmåner. Detta innefattar ett brett utbud av globala utbildningar, vilket ger dig ett unikt och mycket eftertraktat utbildningspaket. Genom att arbeta hos oss lär du snabbt känna kollegor från våra andra kontor runtom i världen och kan bygga upp ett internationellt nätverk som varar livet ut. Detta möjliggörs även genom några av våra olika varianter av secondment där du får arbeta på något av våra övriga kontor. Du får även tidig exponering mot klienter och ansvar att leda stora transaktioner. Detta är möjligt med vår unika plattform som kommer träna och stötta dig i din karriär.
   

  

 För att söka tjänsten skickar du in ditt CV, personliga brev och studieintyg omgående då vi anställer löpande.
   

  

**Start september 2025.**
 För frågor om tjänsten är du välkommen att kontakta:
   

  

 Eleonore Häger, Head of HR via eleonore.hager@linklaters.com
   

  

**Technical Skills**
**This list of duties and responsibilities above is not exhaustive. It is intended to describe the general content of, and requirements for, the performance of this job. As such, the role may also include the undertaking of additional tasks as required.**

title: Client Solutions Manager (12 month Fixed Term Contract) - Global Business Solutions - Sweden
description:
**Responsibilities**
 TikTok is the leading destination for short-form mobile video. At TikTok, our mission is to inspire creativity and bring joy. TikTok's global headquarters are in Los Angeles and Singapore, and its offices include New York, London, Dublin, Paris, Berlin, Dubai, Jakarta, Seoul, and Tokyo.
   

  

 Why Join Us
   

  

 Creation is the core of TikTok's purpose. Our platform is built to help imaginations thrive. This is doubly true of the teams that make TikTok possible.
   

  

 Together, we inspire creativity and bring joy - a mission we all believe in and aim towards achieving every day.
   

  

 To us, every challenge, no matter how difficult, is an opportunity; to learn, to innovate, and to grow as one team. Status quo?
   

  

 Never. Courage? Always.
   

  

 At TikTok, we create together and grow together. That's how we drive impact - for ourselves, our company, and the communities we serve.
   

  

 Join us.
   

  

 Client Solutions Managers are the trusted advocates connecting key stakeholders, providing inspiration and insights, driving collaboration that translate into long term client partnerships and growth! We are responsible for the day to day relationship and for ensuring success of advertiser investment. As trusted partners, we proactively advise our clients of opportunity and solutions to exceed their expectations, securing future investment.
   

  

 We are currently looking for a highly skilled and motivated Client Solutions Manager to help scale our growing advertising business. The Solutions Manager is a key member of the nordic sales team, working with sales, product, and other business partners to analyse and improve advertisers’ performance on TikTok, in support of their marketing initiatives. They will work with our unique data and translate it into high-quality and actionable insights and recommendations to improve the effectiveness of advertiser campaigns and unlock business opportunities.
   

  

**Responsibilities:**
 Day to day, their activities include:
   

  

* Support and grow Nordic client relationships with product adoption and scaled solutions
* Execute strategic account planning aimed at achieving significant investment growth
* Create, test, and scale local initiatives to drive education & inspiration to establish the TikTok suite of products as a leading business-driving platform with agency stakeholders
* Identify new business opportunities for brands and agencies to partner with TikTok
* Collaborate cross-functionally to ensure improvement for product, process and client relationships
* Track and analyse revenue performance across the agency portfolio and identify opportunities for revenue growth
* Meet and exceed revenue targets


**Qualifications**
 Minumum qualifications:
   

  

* Demonstrated experience of account management/performance experience in digital marketing
* Tangible experience executing on a biddable network
* Experience managing brand advertisers with a deep understanding of their challenges across full funnel objectives
* Results oriented with high attention to detail and strong organisational skills


**Preferred Qualifications:**
* Ability to analyse data and identify insights to assess campaign performance
* Proactive attitude with excellent project management, organisational, and analytical skills
* Strong verbal and written communication skills, ability to effectively translate technical language to non-technical stakeholders
* Knowledge and understanding of tracking, attribution and measurement (Pixel, MMP etc)- Experience diagnosing and solving technical problems with product and engineering teams is a big plus- Experience using Excel or Google Sheets essential, familiarity with visualisation tools (Tableau, QlikView, Power BI, etc.) a plus
* Comfortable presenting complex analysis in a simple, easy to digest way to C-suite level stakeholders
* Self-starter, a fast learner who has critical thinking
* Have a passion for TikTok


 TikTok is committed to creating an inclusive space where employees are valued for their skills, experiences, and unique perspectives. Our platform connects people from across the globe and so does our workplace. At TikTok, our mission is to inspire creativity and bring joy. To achieve that goal, we are committed to celebrating our diverse voices and to creating an environment that reflects the many communities we reach. We are passionate about this and hope you are too.

title: Erfaren IT-expert? Ta chansen och bli en del av Saab!
company_industry: Defense and Space Manufacturing, Security and Investigations, and IT Services and IT Consulting
description:
*Vill du vara med och påverka i det större sammanhanget? På Saab bidrar du till hållbarhet som håller människa och samhälle säkert. Tillsammans kan vi påverka – Din del är viktig*
**Din roll**
 Som IT-expert kommer du att ingå i ett team som ansvarar för att övervaka IT-drift, installationer och underhåll av våra komplexa utvecklings- och produktionsmiljöer. Din expertis kommer bidra till att forma en smidig verksamhet genom att säkerställa nätverkseffektvitet, systemsäkerhet och optimal prestanda.
   

  

 Här kommer du tillsammans med kompetenta kollegor att utgöra ryggraden i vår IT-infrastruktur och arbeta i en innovativ miljö. Tillsammans arbetar ni mot uppdraget att hålla människor och samhällen säkra.
   

  

 På Saab erbjuder vi flera spännande roller inom IT området på flera av våra orter i Sverige.
   

  

 Några av de positioner där vi söker din expertis inom:
   

  

* Systemadministratörer
* Applikationsspecialister
* DevOps/DevSecOps
* IT-Arkitekter
* Specialist inom IT-säkerhet
* Dataingenjörer (BI or AI)


**Din profil**
 För att trivas på Saab tror du på en kultur av nyfikenhet, tillit och samarbete. Det spelar ingen roll om du är i början av din karriär eller är expert inom ditt område, det viktigaste är att du delar vår passion för IT och ny spännande teknik!
   

  

 Vi ser gärna att du har några års relevant erfarenhet eller utbildning inom IT och har ett intresse för att ständigt lära dig och utvecklas inom IT området.
   

  

 Befattningen kräver att du genomgår och godkänns enligt vid var tid gällande bestämmelser för säkerhetsskydd. För befattningar där Saab har krav på säkerhetsskyddsplacering kan, i förekommande fall, medföra krav på visst medborgarskap.
   

  

**Det du blir del av**
 Bakom våra innovationer finns alla de som har gjort det möjligt. Modiga pionjärer och kluriga tänkare. Vardagshjältar och kreativa problemlösare. De som delar djup kunskap och de som utforskar nya områden. Och alla däremellan.
   

  

 Här har du chansen att påverka och bidra på ditt unika sätt. Allt från att utveckla kod och bygga imponerande försvars- och säkerhetslösningar till att ta en kaffe med en kollega. Varje bidrag räknas. Vi ger dig möjlighet att anta utmaningar och skapa smarta innovationer. I vår vänliga och tekniksmarta värld finns plats för dig att växa. Vi finns här för att tillsammans skapa trygghet för människor och samhällen.
   

  

 Saab är ett ledande försvars- och säkerhetsföretag med uppdrag att hjälpa nationer att skydda sin befolkning och bidrar till trygghet för människor och samhällen. Med 22 000 talangfulla medarbetare utvecklar Saab teknik och lösningar för en säkrare och mer hållbar värld.
   

  

 Saab utvecklar, tillverkar och underhåller avancerade system inom flygteknik, vapen, ledningssystem, sensorer och undervattenssystem. Saab har sitt huvudkontor i Sverige men en global verksamhet där Saab är en del av många nationers försvarsförmåga. Läs mer om oss här

title: Chef Butiksteknik & Betalning - Coop Sverige
description:
***Chef Butiksteknik & Betalning - Coop Sverige***




  





**Ansök senast:** 
 7 mars 2025
 



**Placering:** 
 Solna
 



  





**Coop söker en strategisk ledare för vår digitala framtid i butik** 




  





 Är du en erfaren och driven IT-ledare med passion för att skapa affärsnytta genom innovativa tekniska lösningar? Coop söker nu en Chef till enheten Butiksteknik & Betalning som är redo att leda vår digitala butiksresa inom dagligvaruhandeln. Det händer mycket inom området, och flera stora projekt pågår. Vi söker dig som vill driva denna spännande och viktiga förändringsresa. Vi tror att du kanske redan haft positionen som IT-chef eller ser det som en framtida karriär.
 



  





**Om rollen** 




 Som Chef Butiksteknik & Betalning hos Coop kommer du att ha det övergripande ansvaret för tjänsteleveranser till våra butiker, inklusive kassasystem, butiksutrustning, e-handel plock och inköpstjänster (B2B). Du kommer också att leda avdelningen för IT infrastruktur och säkerställa att alla nödvändiga processer för butikens verksamhet, såsom finans och logistik, effektivt stöds.
 



  





 Organisationen du leder består ca 30 medarbetare fördelade på fyra team som leds av respektive gruppchef samt två direktrapporterande inom verksamhetsutveckling och tjänsteansvar.
 



  





**Du kommer att arbeta med:** 



* Bygga och leda effektiva team och samarbeten med andra genom tillit, förtroende och engagemang.
* Definiera och fastställa strategi och plan för enhetens område i samarbete med övergripande Coops strategi.
* Ansvara för att kommunicera en tydlig och inspirerande vision för att skapa förståelse, delaktighet och motivation bland teamet.
* Initiera åtgärder för att säkerställa att tjänsteleveranser till butikerna bidrar till affärsnytta.
* Bygga och upprätthålla goda relationer mellan verksamheten och butikerna.
* Säkerställa att det finns återställningsplaner och nödvändig övervakning för stabil tjänsteleverans.
* Hantera budget, kravställning och upphandling av licenser, varor och tjänster i samarbete med inköp och juridik.



  





 Tjänsten är tillsvidare med 6 månaders provanställning med start enligt överenskommelse. Hemma eller på kontoret? Vi brukar säga ”laget för jaget” och förväntar oss att du är på kontoret när du behövs på plats helt enkelt.
 



  





**Kvalifikationer** 




 Vi söker dig som har dokumenterad erfarenhet som ledare inom IT, med god förmåga att driva samverkan mellan avdelningar. Du bör ha stark kommunikativ förmåga, strategisk och analytisk höjd, samt erfarenhet av att leda stora team och driva förändringsarbete.
 



  





**Utbildning:** 



* Kandidatexamen eller högskoleexamen i datavetenskap, teknik eller relaterat område är ett krav.
* MBA eller annan relevant avancerad examen är meriterande.



  





**Erfarenhet och färdigheter:** 



* Dokumenterad erfarenhet som framgångsrik ledare inom IT med personalansvar och betydande inverkan på affären.
* Erfarenhet av produktutveckling och konsumentupplevelse, gärna inom detaljhandel.
* Färdighet i leverantörsstyrning, applikationsutveckling och förvaltning av IT-processer och tjänsteleveranser.
* Dokumenterad erfarenhet av att driva förändring med goda resultat i driftkritiska miljöer.
* Pragmatisk och lösningsorienterad inställning, med förmåga att omsätta strategier till konkreta handlingsplaner.



  





**Personliga egenskaper:** 



* Stark strategisk och analytisk förmåga, med förmåga att motivera och leda teamet.
* Skicklig kommunikatör som skapar förståelse och engagemang.
* Bygger tillit och förtroende inom organisationen och med externa parter.
* Agerar enligt Coops värderingar och säkerställer medarbetares prestation och måluppfyllnad.



  





 Dagligvaruhandeln är en stabil och samhällsviktig bransch. Coop med fyra miljoner medlemmar finns över hela landet och är en viktig del i omställningen mot en grönare och mer hållbar framtid.
 



  





 Du kommer att vara del av en företagskultur präglad prestigelöshet, initiativförmåga och starka värderingar. Vi tar gemensamt ansvar och har en stark vilja att hjälpa varandra att lyckas. Vårt kontor i Solna erbjuder en modern och bra arbetsmiljö med en fantastisk personalrestaurang. På Coop arbetar vi för våra 4 miljoner medlemmar och är därmed Sveriges i särklass största kooperation.
 



  





 Har du frågor om tjänsten är du välkommen att höra av dig till rekryterande chef Lennart Byström. Kontaktuppgifter finner du längre ner på sidan.
 



  





 För att rättvist matcha kandidater med de krav som rollen ställer kommer vi att använda tester under urvalsarbetet.
 



  





 Coop värdesätter kvaliteter som en jämn ålders- och könsfördelning samt etnisk och kulturell mångfald tillför verksamheten.
 



  





 Varmt välkommen med din ansökan till en strategisk och viktig roll i Coops fortsatta digitala resa! Skicka in din ansökan så snart som möjligt då vi jobbar löpande med urval och intervjuer!
 



  





**Om företaget** 




 Coop är en av Sveriges största arbetsgivare och vi drivs av uppgiften att ge alla tillgång till den goda maten. Vi är inne i en spännande förändringsresa mot att vara den
 *goda kraften i mat-Sverige* 
 . Vi ska förenkla vardagen och ge alla tillgång till goda råvaror – något som är bra för både kropp, själ och vår miljö.
 



  





 Tillsammans med våra medarbetare arbetar vi varje dag tillsammans med våra kunder för att fortsätta vara bäst på hållbar utveckling och nu satsar vi ännu mer på att sprida matglädje och mer kärlek till bra råvaror.
 



  





 Vi värdesätter kvaliteter som en jämn ålders- och könsfördelning samt etnisk och kulturell mångfald tillför verksamheten.
 



  





**Kontaktperson** 




 Lennart Byström
 



 lennart.bystrom@coop.se

title: Erfaren utvecklare till AMFs CRM-team i Stockholm!
description:
**Som utvecklare inom CRM hos AMF i Stockholm får du en varierad roll där du bidrar till både tekniska framsteg och samhällsnytta!**
 Vill du arbeta i en varierad miljö inom CRM-området som utvecklare? På AMFs centrala kontor i Stockholm blir du en del av en organisation med samhällsnytta i fokus. Vi hjälper fyra miljoner kunder att få en så hög och trygg pension som möjligt – och du har chansen att bidra med din kompetens och kreativitet för att förbättra våra lösningar.
   

  

**Vi erbjuder dig**
 Hos Oss Påverkar Du Många Människors Framtid – Och Får Ett Jobb Som Du Kan Vara Stolt Över Att Gå Till. Det Innebär Till Exempel
   

  

* En central roll i utvecklingen av CRM-lösningar med fokus på Salesforce Service Cloud och Marketing Cloud.
* Ett agilt arbetssätt tillsammans med erfarna kollegor.
* En arbetsplats med starkt kundfokus och engagerade medarbetare centralt i Stockholm, nära T-centralen.
* En lärande organisation med utbildningsbudget och stort fokus på intern utveckling.


**Det här gör du hos oss**
 I Rollen Som Utvecklare Får Du En Varierad Vardag, Allt Från Att Hantera Den Dagliga Supporten Till Att Ta Fram Helhetslösningar i Nära Samarbete Med Andra Kompetenser. Du Kommer Bland Annat Att
   

  

* Utveckla och förvalta systemlösningar i Salesforce Service Cloud och Marketing Cloud.
* Integrera Salesforce med externa applikationer.
* Bidra till att förbättra och modernisera befintliga lösningar, inklusive arbete med IT-säkerhet.
* Samverka i tvärfunktionella team och med externa leverantörer.
* Dokumentera system och föreslår förbättringsförslag inom ansvarsområdet.


**Ditt team och arbetsplats**
 Du kommer att tillhöra CRM-teamet på AMF som består av utvecklare, testare, kravanalytiker, Scrum Master och Product Owner. Vi jobbar agilt och är ett sammansvetsat team med mycket kompetens och nära samarbete. Vi sitter i trevliga lokaler centralt i Stockholm nära T-centralen.
   

  

**Mer om dig**
 För att lyckas i rollen tror vi att du har erfarenhet av backendutveckling i Java och Azure, med fördel i Salesforce-plattformen. Du har gärna arbetat med Lightning Web Components, Apex, Flows och integrationer via SOAP och REST API. Du har en god förståelse för SQL och är van vid att arbeta agilt.
   

  

 Har du certifieringar inom Salesforce, erfarenhet av Marketing Cloud är det meriterande, likaså om du har har erfarenhet av mjukvaruarkitektur.
   

  

 Som person är du analytisk, nyfiken och lösningsorienterad. Du trivs i en miljö där du får samarbeta med andra och ta eget ansvar. Du är social och har lätt för att knyta kontakter, samtidigt som du delar med dig av din kunskap till teamet.
   

  

**Intresserad?**
 I den här rekryteringen har vi valt att samarbeta med Ada Digital som strävar efter en transparent, inkluderande och snabbrörlig rekryteringsupplevelse. Vi vill veta mer om dig och din potential! Du söker tjänsten enkelt och behöver inte bifoga några dokument. Det räcker med en motivering till varför du söker tjänsten och om du saknar CV kan du bifoga din LinkedIn-profil. Följ sedan din ansökan live via vår hemsida. Urvalet sker löpande och tjänsten kan bli tillsatt före sista ansökningsdatum. Är du nyfiken och vill veta mer innan du söker? Hör av dig till ansvarig rekryterare. Vi ser fram emot att få kontakt med dig!

title: Interimsjurist
description:
*Är du jurist och vill ta konsultuppdrag? Skapa en profil på vår konsultplattform!* 




  





**Om Boardtalk Legal & Compliance** 




 Boardtalk är din partner för rekrytering inom Legal & Compliance, Real Estate och Ekonomi & Finans. Med över 20 års erfarenhet av rekrytering erbjuder vi skräddarsydda lösningar inom juridik, HR, finans och fastighet och gör ca 200 tillsättningar varje år. Vi skapar långsiktiga och framgångsrika partnerskap genom ömsesidigt förtroende.
 



  





 Nu söker vi dig som vill ta interimsuppdrag genom oss!
 



  





**Om vår konsultplattform** 




 Boardtalk Legal & Compliance rekryterar och hyr ut jurister inom samtliga tjänsteområden. Våra kunder är framför allt medelstora företag inom bank & finans, fastighet och IT. Vi har även myndigheter och intresseorganisationer som kunder.
 



  





 Sedan 2002 har vi byggt upp ett omfattande nätverk av underkonsulter och tillsätter idag majoriteten av alla uppdrag med konsulter från nätverket. Genom att skapa en profil på vår konsultplattform kommer du få erbjudanden om nya uppdrag från oss. Uppdragen varierar i längd och kan omfatta allt från ett par timmar i veckan under en tillfällig arbetstopp till heltid i 6-12 månader. Vi erbjuder också externa DPO-lösningar och konsulter för andra compliancefunktioner.
 



  





**Om dig** 




 Du kan antingen agera underkonsult eller bli anställd av oss under uppdraget. Vi samarbetar även med advokatbyråer, juristbyråer och nischade konsultfirmor med anställda konsulter - allt för att ge vår kund den bästa resursen och lösningen.
 



  





*Vill du veta mer om hur vi arbetar med interimslösningar? Kontakta affärsområdeschef Carl Berg på* 
***carl.berg@boardtalk.se***
*eller 072 229 51 42 eller på LinkedIn. Vi ser fram emot att lära känna dig!*

title: Senior Cost Manager
description:
**Overview**
 As a
 **Senior Cost Manager** 
 at Linesight, you will work with highly experienced, culturally diverse, and passionate teams nurturing a strong social dynamic and a shared sense of achievement. You will gain vast industry experience that will open doors for you, extend your skillset and expand your perspective. We will empower, support, and enable you to take real responsibility in your role so that you can take charge of your career progression with us. You will be mentored and supported by industry leaders and given the tools to grow. You will also be involved in and contribute to our business strategy as we continue to evolve. For us lasting trusted relationships are everything, both with our teams and our clients.
   

  

**The Opportunity**
**In This Role You Will**
* Actively participate in the tender/bid process--from initial tender/bid documentation through analysis and reporting
* Manage the change management process - identifying , analyzing, approving, and implementing changes that affect the project cost
* Analyse tenders/bids to ensure client value for money
* Assist in the preparation and agreement of final accounts, including the handling of any claims to ensure the client gets best value from works undertaken
* Create estimates and cost plans for key client developments
* Oversee project spend by creating valuations and cost reports, and clearly communicate variations to your team
* Support nimble project management and clear decisions through excellent cost documentation and timely communication
* Support the settlement of construction disputes/loss and expense claims with transparency
* Foster top performance and growth for your employees via excellent mentorship and leadership


**We Would Love To Hear From You If You**
* Have experience as a senior cost manager, ideally from a consultancy background
* Have experience in pre - contract cost management while be ing experienced in budget control, cost planning, prepar ing and initiat ing change forms for discussion with other project stakeholders wh ile be ing knowledgeable on alternative construction material s
* Are chartered or are on the path to complete it. We can help
* Have a degree or comparable experience in a project management or construction discipline
* Are an excellent communicator verbally and in writing
* Love a dynamic environment with the opportunity to manage your own priorities and deadlines
* Thrive on building strong relationships with your team and clients through a shared purpose and sense of openness and fun


**About Us**
 Linesight is a highly successful global project and cost management consultancy that keeps clients coming back. And for that we have our people to thank. You see we’re not like the others. We’re different. Unique. It’s our fresh thinking and focus on what matters that has led to our evolving. We are on a journey working in some of the most exciting innovative sectors with some of the world’s most prestigious companies delivering major projects that deliver a more sustainable built environment. We have an open culture and a flat structure where you can expect to be treated with genuine care, respect, and empathy. With Linesight, you can truly discover the power of team!
   

  

 Diversity, inclusion and accessibility
   

  

 Linesight is committed to transparent, equal opportunity employment practices. We are building a diverse and inclusive organisation, accessible to all, based on having a safe culture which enables all our people to be their true selves. We are a people business, and we understand that the more inclusive we are, the happier our people and better our work will be. We will ensure that individuals with disability are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the application or recruitment process and are accommodated in the workplace. If you require assistance or accommodation of any kind, please mention this in your application, we would love to hear from you!

title: Chef a la Carte - Brasserie NÒR Södermalm
description:
*About Clarion Hotel: Clarion Hotel® is not just a hotel chain; it's an immersive experience that combines Scandinavian hospitality with a touch of premium. Our team members are not merely employees; they are an integral part of the Clarion experience. We pride ourselves on delivering on personality, passion, and we always strive for perfection. Join us in shaping the future of hospitality! Clarion Hotel® is part of Strawberry.*
*Brasserie NÒR is a modern brasserie that celebrates Nordic cuisine with a firm and stable footing in Europe. This means we take care of our local ingredients and traditional dishes but update them with Central European flavors. Recognition with a twist!*
*With style, finesse and a little mystery, NÒR invites you to an unforgettable experience with "All day dining", where you will find all the classic favorite dishes seasoned with new inspiration, creativity and courage.*
 We are looking for a tasteful, orderly and curious chef for our kitchen team
   

  

 The service includes:
   

  

* Help to ensure the daily operation.
* Be responsible for the different sections in the kitchen
* You are able to properly prep for service and keep the required production.
* Ensure all dishes meet the restaurants quality standards in terms of flavor, presentation and timing.
* Keep good communication with the immediate manager and the rest of the team.
* As a part of the kitchen team you are responsible to maintain a good level of hygiene, health and safety and keep workstations clean and organized throughout service


 Requirements:
   

  

* Minimum 3 years of experience from a similar position
* In-depth knowledge of French and Nordic cuisine, sauces, cooking methods, classic and modern techniques.
* Ability to work as part of a team with initiative and creativity.
* You are flexible, stress-resistant and have a professional and personal attitude towards colleagues and guests.
* You are able to focus on precision when preparing and plating each dish to meet the customer expectation.
* Able to communicate in English and Swedish
* Work ethic, punctual,reliable and willing to go above and beyond to deliver a great experience
* You are available to work nights and weekends


 We offer :
   

  

* Part time employment
* Opportunities for career development and growth within the Strawberry group.
* Staff discounts and preferential friends & family rates at our 200+ hotels.
* 25% discount on food and drinks at all our restaurants and bars.


 Does this seem like a perfect match for you? Send your application, Hiring is ongoing.

title: Lead Product Designer
description:
**Why Join Us?**
 At Tobii Dynavox, we empower people with disabilities to do what they once did or never thought possible. We call this mission Power to Be You. Our assistive communication technology helps our customers express themselves, connect with the world, and pursue independence, whether through everyday activities like ordering food or extraordinary feats like running a company. Working at Tobii Dynavox, you’ll become part of a team that spans the globe, with offices in the US, Sweden, France, the UK, China, and beyond.
   

  

 To learn more about what we make possible, meet some of our customers or take a look at some of our solutions.
   

  

 We’re at an exciting stage in our journey—growing rapidly and expanding our Product & Development team in Stockholm to build a vibrant hub for innovation, product design, and technology. This is a unique opportunity to join a thriving organization where you can help shape the future of assistive communication, defining how we work and delivering impactful solutions for our users.
   

  

**About the Role:**
 As the
 **Lead Product Designer** 
 , you will drive the design vision and strategy for our communication software. You will work at the intersection of design, technology, and business, leading initiatives that enhance usability, accessibility, and delight. This is a high-impact role where your expertise will influence the product vision and strategy while ensuring the seamless execution of design excellence.
   

  

**In this role, you will:**
* Define and champion the design vision, aligning it with product and business goals while measuring success.
* Lead by example with hands-on design work while mentoring other designers to elevate their craft and guide design processes.
* Own complex design projects from ideation to execution, ensuring exceptional results.
* Collaborate with cross-functional leads (product, engineering) to deliver innovative and impactful solutions.
* Use user research, data, and usability testing to inform and validate design decisions.
* Shape the product strategy and roadmap with a focus on user experience.
* Advocate for design as a core component of solving complex problems and driving business success.


**What We're Looking For:**
* 8+ years of experience in product design, particularly for complex or enterprise-level software.
* Expertise in cross-functional collaboration and facilitation, coordinating efforts across multiple teams, incorporating feedback, and leading impactful design discussions.
* Strong experience managing multiple projects while delivering high-quality design outcomes.
* Experience building and maintaining design systems.
* Strong knowledge of accessibility standards and best practices (e.g., WCAG).


**Our Values:**
 At Tobii Dynavox, our mission guides what we do, and our values guide us in how we do it. Across the organization, we are committed to being Collaborative, Considerate, Curious and Courageous. We build a trusting environment where every team member prioritizes our customers with empathy and insight. Bold ideas and learning lead to impactful solutions. Driven by curiosity, we continuously challenge the status quo to create meaningful, customer-focused solutions for our customers.
   

  

**What We Offer:**
 At Tobii Dynavox, we believe in empowering individuals – including our employees - to reach their full potential. Here’s what makes us unique:
   

  

* Purpose-Driven Work: Join a company that transforms lives by giving a voice to those with communication challenges. Every day, your work makes a meaningful and concrete impact.
* “Yes, and...” Flexibility: Build a rewarding career AND enjoy time with loved ones. We offer flexible work options so you don’t have to choose between personal and professional goals.
* Growth and Development: Whether you’re advancing your skills or growing your career, we invest in your future with training, learning opportunities, and internal growth paths.
* Inclusive and Supportive Culture: Work in a collaborative, caring environment where diversity and individuality are valued. You’ll feel connected to both your team and our global community.
* A Global Leader with Heart: Be part of an innovative, forward-thinking company that combines experience and cutting-edge solutions with a mission to change lives.

title: Head of High Risk Workout
description:
**Job ID: 28802**
 Are you ready to oversee and drive the execution of restructuring and workout strategies for medium and large high risk corporates? Nordea’s Leveraged, Institutional and Special Credit group is seeking a dynamic Head of High Risk Workout to lead the team working at the forefront of financial restructurings in the Nordic’s largest bank.
   

  

 At Nordea, we believe in integrity, expertise, and collaboration. If you have a strong strategic mindset, a deep understanding of distressed financial situations, and the ability to oversee high-stakes execution in a dynamic environment, this is your opportunity to make a significant impact.
   

  

**About Our Team**
 Welcome to our High Risk Workout team, which is part of Leveraged, Institutional and Special Credit. You will report to the Head of Leveraged, Institutional and Special Credit and will be responsible for ensuring the execution of structured workout and restructuring strategies in alignment with Nordea’s risk framework.
   

  

 The position will be located in one of the Nordic capitals.
   

  

**What You Will Be Doing**
 As the Head of High Risk Workout, you will be responsible for ensuring that workout and restructuring strategies are effectively implemented to protect value, mitigate risk, and achieve the best possible outcomes for our customers and Nordea. You will lead our cross border team of senior Workout and Restructuring Executives, ensuring that each case is managed with a structured, strategic, and risk-aware approach. The mission of the team is to help the customer and the bank through the challenging times.
   

  

**Main responsibilities in this role:**
* Overseeing and ensuring the execution of Nordea’s strategic frameworks for workouts and restructuring of high-risk corporate exposures
* Managing and leading the High Risk Workout team, ensuring consistency and effectiveness in handling complex, distressed financial situations
* Ensuring that cases are approached with a structured, strategic mindset, balancing commercial, financial, legal, and reputational considerations
* Guiding and challenging workout strategies, ensuring alignment with risk appetite and overall bank objectives
* Ensuring effective internal collaboration across credit, legal, risk, and other key stakeholders to optimize decision-making
* Overseeing high-stakes negotiations, ensuring that the team is effectively managing stakeholder relationships, including companies management, boards, external advisors and financial institutions
* Monitoring industry trends and regulatory changes, adapting workout strategies to reflect best practices and new developments
* Strengthening internal frameworks and processes, driving continuous improvement in Nordea’s workout and restructuring capabilities


**Who You Are**
 Collaboration. Ownership. Passion. Courage. These are the values that guide us in being at our best – and that we imagine you share with us.
   

  

**In order to succeed in this role, we believe that you:**
* Have a strong strategic mindset, deep financial expertise, and the ability to oversee execution in complex restructuring cases
* Are a proven leader with experience in overseeing and ensuring execution of financial restructuring, corporate workouts, or distressed asset management
* Are a strategic thinker with the ability to translate high-level restructuring principles into effective, practical execution
* Have a deeply knowledgeable in credit risk management, insolvency frameworks, and restructuring methodologies
* Are a strong negotiator and decision-maker, able to ensure that cases are managed proactively and with a focus on risk-adjusted outcomes
* Are an confident communicator, capable of providing clear strategic direction and ensuring alignment across multiple stakeholders
* Are an adaptable and resilient, able to oversee execution in a fast-changing and often uncertain environment


**Your experience and background:**
* Extensive experience in managing and overseeing restructuring and workout strategies within a financial institution
