title: Senior HR Business Partner, Europe North, AGS EMEA PXT
description:
- Experience of operating at a senior HR level with demonstrated success in meeting exceptionally high standards in a high volume, fast-paced environment
- University degree in Business Administration, Human Resources or related field is required
- Demonstrated ability to understand business goals and recommend new approaches, strategies and initiatives to effect continual improvements in business objectives, productivity and development of AWS Global Sales HR within the company
- A true hands-on approach as well as the ability to successfully monitor the “pulse” of the employee and corporate group to ensure a high level of employee engagement
- Experience with rapid and complex changing work environment
- Coaching and mentoring experience of Executives and Leaders of Leaders
- Success in creating and driving effective development, employee relations, retention and reward programs, with a passion for learning and development
- For us, the culture fit is non-negotiable – you will be Customer Obsessed with the ability to Think Big, Dive Deep and Deliver Results with a Bias for Action
- You will be comfortable with a high-volume workload and not be afraid to “roll up your sleeves”
- You will have a strong-solutions focus and be comfortable working in an environment which demands strong deliverables 
- You will be able to effectively collaborate across multiple functions and as part of a global HR team 
- Ability to use data driven analysis to identify problems and build solutions
- Strong internal and external customer focus 
- Must be able to interface at all levels of the organization and across matrix functions
- Strong project and program management skills 
- Excellent organizational and interpersonal skills
  

We are looking for an exceptional Human Resources Leader to strategically drive the development and implementation of the HR strategy for our AWS Global Sales (AGS) business in Europe North.
Key job responsibilities
• Be a core, strategic and trusted member of the AGS PXT team
• Be responsible for building and driving the people agenda to deliver results including creating initiatives to drive performance and accelerate the growth of the business
• Lead the annual HR talent management cycle relating to talent and performance management, compensation management, succession planning, and leadership development for the organizations
• Partner with the business on organizational design, workforce planning, succession planning, and skills assessment and development
  

* Masters Degree in HR or MBA
* 10-5 years HR experience, ideally working with Cloud/Tech Sales professionals
* Experience in managing and leading organizational change, and strategic HR management
* Key Leadership Principles for the role: Customer Obsession, Ownership, Learn and Be Curious, Earn Trust and Bias for Action

  

Amazon is an equal opportunities employer. We believe passionately that employing a diverse workforce is central to our success. We make recruiting decisions based on your experience and skills. We value your passion to discover, invent, simplify and build. Protecting your privacy and the security of your data is a longstanding top priority for Amazon. Please consult our Privacy Notice (https://www.amazon.jobs/en/privacy\_page) to know more about how we collect, use and transfer the personal data of our candidates.  

  

Our inclusive culture empowers Amazonians to deliver the best results for our customers. If you have a disability and need a workplace accommodation or adjustment during the application and hiring process, including support for the interview or onboarding process, please visit https://amazon.jobs/content/en/how-we-hire/accommodations for more information. If the country/region you’re applying in isn’t listed, please contact your Recruiting Partner.

title: Enterprise Account Manager
description:
At Bluebeam, we empower people to advance the way the world is built. We create smart software solutions that make construction sites more efficient, connected and safe and improve the lives of design and construction professionals everywhere.  


The **Account Manager** works with a dedicated list of named current and target Bluebeam customers in the Nordics to maximize their spend with Bluebeam. These organizations are typically 750+ or more employees, primarily within the AEC industry. The Account Manager also partners with other teams at Bluebeam, such as, Technical Account Management, Customer Operations, Professional Services, Technical Support and Legal/Security to effectively guide customers through purchases of Bluebeam products and services. The Account Manager is responsible for renewing, upselling and cross selling all customers within their book of business.  


**More about what you'll do:**
* Maintain and grow business
* Ensure 100% of annual quota is attained or exceeded
* Ensure all new leads are contacted within 24 hours
* Maintain a pro-active consultative approach with all customers on assigned list
* Be initial Bluebeam contact point for all assigned accounts
* Effectively negotiate value-based agreements with all customers
* Proficiently use SFDC to record events in assigned accounts and individual key metrics
* Accurately forecast via SFDC
* Partner and develop professional working relationships and initiatives with other Bluebeam internal business partners

  


**Here’s what we’d like to see in you:**
* **5+ years in a full cycle software/SaaS sales role**
* **Knowledge of the AEC (Architecture, Engineering, Construction) sector would be highly desirable**
* Strong communication skills, with fluency in Swedish and English
* Strong problem-solving skills and comfort with change
* Experience in using Salesforce or other CRM
* Firm understanding of internal software applications that allow for enhanced territory management including Microsoft Office, Salesforce, PowerBI, Slack and etc.
* Ability to effectively present to all levels of a business, including the C-Suite

  


**Travel: Ability and willingness to travel**
* This role will require traveling to locations including professional office buildings, construction site offices, active construction sites, and attending trade shows and industry events.

  


**What We Offer:**
* People-focused, entrepreneurial start-up culture with the backing of a stable, global, corporate entity – Nemetschek
* Competitive compensation and benefits package (medical, dental, education reimbursement and wellness resources)
* Work-life balance fostered through a culture of diversity, inclusion, and appreciation of individual lifestyle needs
* You will have the opportunity for continuous professional development

  


***Bluebeam is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace. We are committed to equal opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, gender, gender identity, parental or pregnancy status, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, or veteran status.***  


**About Bluebeam**
The construction industry is adopting new technology at a feverish pace. Tablets and cell phones are replacing paper blueprints, drones are surveying jobsites in 3D, and cloud collaboration is changing the way teams work together. Bluebeam plays a crucial role in this transformation. The key to our success is a customer-focused approach to product development: we work with the industry to create solutions for the industry. Today, over 2 million people throughout the world use Bluebeam. In the US, we’re a critical partner for the majority of top AEC firms, and rapidly expanding our presence globally, with offices in Sweden, Germany and the UK.  


#bluebeam
#-MB1
company_description: Since 2002, Bluebeam, Inc. has been at the forefront of the digital revolution in construction technology. Today, over 3 million people in 160+ countries use Bluebeam software to mark up, collaborate

title: Senior Expert BCSS R&D Dev Env
description:
**Join our Team**
-----------------


**About this opportunity:**  

Software Production System (SPS) has the ambition to provide a compelling state of the art software Production System, to give BCSS R&D and Ericsson a competitive advantage in development of Cloud Native products for 5G and 6G. SPS secures a Development Environment based on clouds, telecom networks, software pipelines, lab infra and tools. Examples of concepts/areas in focus are Platform Engineering, Golden Paths, Gen AI and IT security.

  

We are now looking for a Senior Expert who can lead the work with our Development Environment Architecture serving BCSS R&D, the work is done in cooperation with other parts of Ericsson R&D. We continue to evolve our environment, an important part is to meet expectations in the areas IT Security and Developer Experience.

 **What you will do:**

* Own and evolve our Development Environment architecture. Compile development & architecture plans in the area and propose new solutions that impacts the technology strategy for the area.
* Engage with stakeholders, vendors, academia, and open forums and convey BCSS positioning within the domain.
* Keep up to date with latest technology trends in the industry and research by academia, maintain an external contact network with external companies and vendors.
* Maintain a strong internal contact network spanning across relevant internal organizations, act as coach and mentor actively sharing knowledge within Ericsson and inspire the organization to adopt new technology and new aspects.

 **The skills you bring:**

* MSc level in a technical field or the equivalent level of knowledge
* 10+ years - Extensive Leadership in Software development and R&D
* Deep understanding of Cloud Native software development including continuous design, integration, deployment, and operation.
* Experience in Development Environment tools, process and methods that support efficient development organizations.
* Track record from System Management and Architecture leadership including leading teams.
* Excellent people/leadership and mentoring skills in line with Ericsson core values.
* A broad experience of the Ericsson product portfolio with a solid understanding of PDU’s and services needs to be successful.
* Excellent presentation, communication and interpersonal skills, speak & write English fluently.
**Why join Ericsson?**


At Ericsson, you´ll have an outstanding opportunity. The chance to use your skills and imagination to push the boundaries of what´s possible. To build solutions never seen before to some of the world’s toughest problems. You´ll be challenged, but you won’t be alone. You´ll be joining a team of diverse innovators, all driven to go beyond the status quo to craft what comes next.

title: Test Environment Architect
description:
**Join our Team**
-----------------



In the Product Integration Environment Release Automation department, we have several stakeholders from system management, development team, engineering environment, solution testing and customer units. It gives us unique overview of the product development flow.  

You would work in a product test program for a Packet Core Cloud Native products to provide technical leadership and strategic direction for non-functional test and test environment. You would guide and follow up on non-functional development, automation and processes. Test Architects concentrates on the “HOW” in SW testing. You would define requirements for the automation framework, requirements for efficient and effective test lab, provide assignments to system test and guard the test architecture. And you would participate in the prioritization and implementation.

  

The job offers a variety with few recurrent tasks. Either you work on new strategic initiatives, or you fix emergencies. You need to enjoy working hands on with new challenges and be an excellent trouble shooter.  

You will ensure “test aspects” are considered throughout the development life cycle. Synchronize so that test evolution matches product maturity and evolution. Continuously initiate activities so that test may be more efficient and effective

 **What you will do**  

* You would drive and participate in development of test architecture e.g. prototyping work in the test [lab] environment. You would participate in or lead competence group and Test technical forum.
* You would collaborate with Release program, development teams and Infrastructure / tools teams with regards to test tools, test processes, test environment and test methods. You would in close collaboration with the Technical Test Coordinator to optimize test flow, suggest and drive test improvements and give input to the test Strategy.
* You would collect, optimize, and visualize the lab need and usage with close collaboration with Engineering Environment team and the other Test Architects. Spread mindset and awareness regarding the efficient and effective usage of out test channels.
**What you will bring**

* Problem solving: You need to enjoy and excel at trouble shooting. You generate innovations and come up with concept of how to make our testing more effective. You create scripts in Python to facilitate work if needed.
* Test Knowledge: Knowledge about SW Quality Assurance, test frameworks, CI/CD tools and technology stacks. Knowledge about the 4G/5G Packet Core products and Could Native.
* Understanding HW architecture, switches, and route protocol would be an advantage. It is good to have hands on experience with RH OpenShift.
* Strategic technical Leadership: You are comfortable in taking technical decisions and able to create business cases for investments. A strategic mindset, an ability to align technical decisions with business goals, identifying opportunities for innovation and differentiation in a highly competitive industry. You stake out the path forwards.
* Communication skills: As you work with many different stakeholders you need to be able to adapt you communication to hold deep technical training sessions, summarize a business case to program managers or giving a technical overview of Ericsson’s QA process to a customer.
* Degree: BSc/MSc degree in Computer Science, Engineering Physics, Mathematics, Telecommunication or the equivalent level of knowledge.
**Why join Ericsson?**


At Ericsson, you´ll have an outstanding opportunity. The chance to use your skills and imagination to push the boundaries of what´s possible. To build solutions never seen before to some of the world’s toughest problems. You´ll be challenged, but you won’t be alone. You´ll be joining a team of diverse innovators, all driven to go beyond the status quo to craft what comes next.  

  

**What happens once you apply?**

We truly believe that by collaborating with people with different experiences we drive innovation, which is essential for our future growth. We encourage people from all backgrounds to apply and realize their full potential as part of our Ericsson team. Ericsson is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. learn more.

title: Test Environment Architect
description:
**Join our Team**
-----------------



In the Product Integration Environment Release Automation department, we have several stakeholders from system management, development team, engineering environment, solution testing and customer units. It gives us unique overview of the product development flow.  

You would work in a product test program for a Packet Core Cloud Native products to provide technical leadership and strategic direction for non-functional test and test environment. You would guide and follow up on non-functional development, automation and processes. Test Architects concentrates on the “HOW” in SW testing. You would define requirements for the automation framework, requirements for efficient and effective test lab, provide assignments to system test and guard the test architecture. And you would participate in the prioritization and implementation.

  

The job offers a variety with few recurrent tasks. Either you work on new strategic initiatives, or you fix emergencies. You need to enjoy working hands on with new challenges and be an excellent trouble shooter.  

You will ensure “test aspects” are considered throughout the development life cycle. Synchronize so that test evolution matches product maturity and evolution. Continuously initiate activities so that test may be more efficient and effective

 **What you will do**  

* You would drive and participate in development of test architecture e.g. prototyping work in the test [lab] environment. You would participate in or lead competence group and Test technical forum.
* You would collaborate with Release program, development teams and Infrastructure / tools teams with regards to test tools, test processes, test environment and test methods. You would in close collaboration with the Technical Test Coordinator to optimize test flow, suggest and drive test improvements and give input to the test Strategy.
* You would collect, optimize, and visualize the lab need and usage with close collaboration with Engineering Environment team and the other Test Architects. Spread mindset and awareness regarding the efficient and effective usage of out test channels.
**What you will bring**

* Problem solving: You need to enjoy and excel at trouble shooting. You generate innovations and come up with concept of how to make our testing more effective. You create scripts in Python to facilitate work if needed.
* Test Knowledge: Knowledge about SW Quality Assurance, test frameworks, CI/CD tools and technology stacks. Knowledge about the 4G/5G Packet Core products and Could Native.
* Understanding HW architecture, switches, and route protocol would be an advantage. It is good to have hands on experience with RH OpenShift.
* Strategic technical Leadership: You are comfortable in taking technical decisions and able to create business cases for investments. A strategic mindset, an ability to align technical decisions with business goals, identifying opportunities for innovation and differentiation in a highly competitive industry. You stake out the path forwards.
* Communication skills: As you work with many different stakeholders you need to be able to adapt you communication to hold deep technical training sessions, summarize a business case to program managers or giving a technical overview of Ericsson’s QA process to a customer.
* Degree: BSc/MSc degree in Computer Science, Engineering Physics, Mathematics, Telecommunication or the equivalent level of knowledge.
**Why join Ericsson?**


At Ericsson, you´ll have an outstanding opportunity. The chance to use your skills and imagination to push the boundaries of what´s possible. To build solutions never seen before to some of the world’s toughest problems. You´ll be challenged, but you won’t be alone. You´ll be joining a team of diverse innovators, all driven to go beyond the status quo to craft what comes next.

title: Marketing & Content Interns
description:
**Company Description**
 Devoteam G Cloud is an award-winning Google Cloud partner known for its innovative and collaborative culture. With a team of over 600 Google Cloud experts, we deliver cutting-edge solutions to businesses across the globe. Our Stockholm office is a hub for creativity and technological advancement.
   

  

  

**Job Description**
 We're looking for talented interns to join our team in
 **Stockholm** 
 this spring (
 **February - May 2025** 
 ). Are you passionate about content, SEO, and design? Or do you thrive in the fast-paced world of marketing and events? We have exciting opportunities in two key areas:
   

* **SEO & Content:** 
 Boost your skills in content creation, SEO, design, and event planning. Contribute to blog posts, social media content, website updates, and more.
* **Marketing:** 
 Dive into social media management, email campaigns, market analysis, and event coordination. Help us reach new audiences and promote our services.


  

  

**Qualifications**
* Currently pursuing or recently completed a degree in marketing, communications, business, or a related field.
* Excellent communication and social media skills.
* Basic understanding of SEO, analytics, and content creation.
* Strong teamwork abilities and eagerness to learn.
* Ability to create visual content (designs, videos, etc.) is a plus.


  

  

**Additional Information**
**What You Gain:**
* **Hands-on experience:** 
 Apply your skills to real-world projects and make a tangible impact.
* **Mentorship:** 
 Learn from experienced professionals and Google Cloud experts.
* **Networking opportunities:** 
 Build connections with leaders in the tech industry.
* **Cutting-edge knowledge:** 
 Gain insight into the world of cloud computing and the latest Google Cloud technologies.
* **Personal and professional growth:** 
 Develop your skills and confidence in a dynamic and supportive environment.


**Additional Information:**
 This is an
 
**unpaid** 

 internship opportunity based in our
 **Stockholm** 
 office.
   

  

**Apply Now!**
 Tell us which role you think you're best suited for (SEO & Content or Marketing) and submit your CV along with a motivational letter explaining why you're the perfect fit for Devoteam G Cloud!

title: Infrastructure security
description:
Role : Infrastructure security
 



 Location : Stockholm, Stockholm County, Sweden
 



 Job Type : Contract
 



 Experience : 5+ years
 



 Contact Email : anusha.kusuma@cubane.se
 



 Contact Person : Anusha Kusuma
 



  





**Description:** 




 Infrastructure security
 



  





 Handelsbanken needs a consultant for the team responsible for implementing the SericeNow platform as a SaaS service. Especially with security-related issues, PKI and Encryption technologies, EntraID (formerly Azure AD), Azure KeyVault and other KeyVault solutions.
 



  





 Competence requirements
 



  





 - In addition to the above, experience in programming in JavaScript, Java and .NET is a plus, and it is an added advantage if you have developed JavaScript within the ServiceNow platform.
 



 - You have several years of experience working with Azure Pipelines to manage code and CI/CD processes. It is an advantage if you have experience using Azure Pipelines to lift code between different ServiceNow instances.
 



 - You have experience in building your own certificate-based Kafka consumers. If you have also developed a consumer against the ServiceNow platform's Log Export Services, it is an added plus. You understand how to handle real-time streaming of data in a secure and optimized way.
 



 - Through active knowledge sharing, you contribute to creating a learning organization and a stronger development culture.

title: Windowsspecialist med Nätverkskunskap
description:
*Vi på Iver ger samma löfte till våra kollegor som till våra kunder. Löftet är att alltid vara ”* 
 beside you”, ”behind you” och ”before you”. Vi kallar det för ”The Iver way”.
 *Nu söker vi en "Windowsspecialist med Nätverkskunskap" som vill bli en del av Iver och som vill vara med och bidra till bättre IT-lösningar som gör skillnad för våra kunder! Är du vår nya kollega?*
**Rollen Som Windowsspecialist**
 Vi söker en erfaren Windowsspecialist med goda kunskaper inom nätverk för att stärka vårt team. I denna roll kommer du att arbeta med drift, underhåll och utveckling av våra kunders IT-miljöer, med fokus på Windows-baserade system och nätverksinfrastruktur.
   

  

 Du kommer att vara en nyckelperson i att säkerställa hög tillgänglighet, stabilitet och säkerhet. Tjänsten innebär både operativt och strategiskt arbete, där du får möjlighet att påverka och förbättra våra kunders IT-miljö.
   

  

 Du kommer att vara en del av ett kundteam med ansvar för några av våra kunders tjänsteleverans. Vi arbetar med områden så som arkitektur, projekt, drift/förvaltning av våra kunders infrastruktur och nät. Våra kunder är ofta stora nordiska företag, fintech, startups eller myndigheter med krav på hög nivå av informationssäkerhet och lösningar i teknisk framkant. Vissa av dem utgör samhällskritisk verksamhet.
   

  

**Arbetsuppgifter**
* Administration, underhåll och felsökning av Windows Server-miljöer
* Hantering av Active Directory, GPO, DNS, DHCP och andra Windows-tjänster
* Övervakning och optimering av nätverksinfrastruktur (LAN/WAN, brandväggar, switchar, VPN)
* Säkerhetsarbete, inklusive patchhantering och skydd mot intrång
* Implementering och hantering av backup- och återställningslösningar
* Dokumentation och förbättring av IT-processer


**Vad erbjuder vi dig?**
 Iver - We empower our Nordic society. Hos Iver får du möjlighet att arbeta med den senaste tekniken och vara med på en spännande tillväxtresa. På Iver är vi inkluderande och strävar efter genuint samarbete där vi arbetar mot gemensamma mål. Inom Iver finns stora möjligheter till utveckling och vi står bakom dig när du vill lära dig mer – inom ditt specialområde, ledarskap eller nya områden. Hos Iver är du också en del av ett ambitiöst och innovativt företag, vilket innebär att förbättra, testa, utvärdera och våga ändra hur vi gör saker är viktiga ingredienser och vi är övertygade om att det är så vi utvecklas.
   

  

**Din Bakgrund Och Profil**
 Du plockade troligen sönder den första dator du fick bara för att se hur den fungerar, och du har lagt en ansenlig mängd tid på att bygga Lego under din uppväxt. Din vilja att förstå hur saker fungerar är mer än bara ett arbete eller inlärt beteende. Därutöver trivs du sannolikt av att jobba i ett högpresterande team och drivs av viljan att göra tekniska lösningar i framkant ännu bättre.
   

  

 För att lyckas i rollen vill vi att du har:
   

  

* Flera års erfarenhet av Windows-serveradministration
* Erfarenhet av utveckling av arkitektur och design för Active Directory
* Proaktivt underhållsarbete för AD / ADFS / Windows Server
* PowerShell
* Nätverk, tcp/ip och brandvägg
* Erfarenhet av Windows failover kluster


**Meriterande Kunskaper**
* Erfarenhet av att arbeta med Microsoft Exchange
* Produktionsmiljö med särskilda krav på informationssäkerhet och tillgänglighet
* MS PKI / Certifikathantering
* Övervakning och visualisering med exempelvis Prometheus, Grafana, Kibana
* Virtualisering


***Vi kommer att göra bakgrundskontroller i rekryteringsprocessen. Svenskt medborgarskap är ett krav.***
**Placeringsort**
 Iver har kontor i Sverige och Norge. Denna roll är placerad i
 **Solna** 
 i härliga lokaler.
   

  

**Sök till oss!**
 Urval sker löpande, tjänsten kan tillsättas före sista ansökningsdag. Iver eftersträvar en jämn könsfördelning och värdesätter etnisk och kulturell mångfald. Önskad start är snarast eller enligt överenskommelse. Sista ansökningsdag: 2025-03-16. Du är välkommen att kontakta Melvin Obita (melvin.obita@iver.se) vid frågor eller funderingar kring tjänsten. Vi ser fram emot din ansökan!
   

  

 Välkommen till Iver!
   

  

**We empower our Nordic society** 
 . Iver är en ledande nordisk helhetsleverantör av molnbaserade IT-tjänster med spetskompetens inom drift, cybersäkerhet, cloud och innovation.
   

  

**Våra tjänster är kritiska inte bara för våra kunder – utan för digitaliseringen av samhället i stort.** 
 Vi säkerställer att sjukvården har tillgång till rätt patientdata, att samhällskritiska system aldrig ligger nere och att flygplanen landar säkert. Som en lyhörd och affärsnära helhetspartner möjliggör vi våra kunders innovation – idag och imorgon.

title: Senior Technical Engineer - Store Payments
description:
**Job Description**
**About the team:**
 The Store Payments Enablement team is a key part of H&M’s Business Tech organization, operating within the Product Development & Engineering Center. Our mission is to deliver secure, modular payment solutions that balance cost efficiency with competitive time-to-market delivery. As a global team, we support card and alternative payment methods across all H&M stores, brands, and markets.
   

  

 Led by a dedicated Product Manager, our vision is to enable fast, secure, and frictionless payments. Driven by a passion for payment technology, we deliver best-in-class services for our customers and stakeholders.
   

  

**About the role:**
 As a Senior Technical Engineer, you will be responsible for the design, configuration, and development of new payment technologies to be introduced at H&M. You will work with a variety of payment technologies, including collaborating closely with Payment Service Providers, to deliver innovative, scalable, and secure solutions that enhance the in-store payment experience for our customers.
   

  

 Collaboration is central to this role. You will partner with teams across the organization, including those responsible for customer experience, core platform technology, technical infrastructure, and IT operations. Additionally, you will engage with Treasury, Cyber Security, Procurement, and Regional Teams to ensure alignment and integration of payment solutions with H&M’s broader business and operational objectives.
   

  

 In your role, you will combine your technical engineering expertise with deep business knowledge to design, develop, and integrate complex systems—both from vendors and in-house. You will support the full lifecycle of payment technologies, focusing on accessibility, optimization, and security. Your work will ensure the delivery of reliable, mission-critical solutions that create value for H&M's customers and the business, while continuously driving improvements to meet evolving needs.
   

  

**Responsibilities:**
* Technical Expertise & Vendor Collaboration: Act as a technical advisor in commercial negotiations, procurement, and escalations with Payment Service Providers (PSPs), Point-of-Sale (POS) vendors, and other partners.
* Requirements Gathering & Documentation: Capture and document both functional and non-functional requirements in collaboration with Business Experts, Retail Project Leads, Regional Teams and other stakeholders to ensure global and local needs are met.
* Development & Integration: Ensure the implementation, configuration, and integration of payment solutions with POS systems, PSPs, and internal platforms, supporting both legacy modernization and new technology adoption.
* Testing & Quality Assurance: Design, test, and validate payment solutions, maintaining test environments with payment terminals, networks, and integrations to support stability, scalability, and security.
* Problem Management: Identify, analyze, and resolve payment-related issues, including root-cause analysis of larger payment related problems in partnership with vendors and relevant stakeholders.
* Security & Compliance: Ensure all payment solutions adhere to PCI-DSS, GDPR, ISO, and other security and regulatory requirements, maintaining a secure and compliant payment environment.
* Technical Leadership & Knowledge Sharing: Serve as the team's technical subject matter expert, producing documentation, and driving best practices in system performance, automation, and analytics.
* Project & Stakeholder Engagement: Drive technical projects from inception to completion, engage with management and other key stakeholders on progress and achievements, and collaborate with cross-functional teams to maximize business value.


**Qualifications**
* Complex problem-solving skills with a focus on continuous improvement and innovation.
* Deep expertise in payment technologies and processes.
* Experience in designing platform architectures based on the latest payment technologies and innovations.
* Ability to work on technology-agnostic, high-performing, secure payment solutions that meet customer needs.
* Proficient in user testing, including automated testing, test case creation and deployment of technical solutions.
* Understanding of networking principles relevant to payment systems.
* Experience in researching and applying emerging payment trends in design, architecture, and engineering
* Strong knowledge of security best practices and compliance requirements (e.g., PCI-DSS, GDPR).
* Ability to work effectively both independently and collaboratively in multidisciplinary teams.
* Proven informal leadership skills, including managing dependencies and cross-team coordination with both technical and non-technical stakeholders
* Some project management experience, including tracking, reporting, risk management, and issue resolution is an advantage
* Familiarity with cloud technologies and cloud-based payment solutions is an advantage


**Additional Information**
 This is a fulltime permanent position. The role is
 **based in our office in Stockholm, Sweden** 
 .
   

  

 Apply by sending in your
 **CV in English** 
 as soon as possible. Due to data policies, we only accept applications through career page.
   

  

**Benefits**
 We offer all our employees at H&M Group attractive benefits with extensive development opportunities around the globe. All our employees receive a staff discount card, usable on all our H&M Group brands in stores and online. Brands covered by the discount are H&M (Beauty and Move included), COS, Weekday, Monki, H&M HOME, & Other Stories, ARKET, Afound. In addition to our staff discount, all our employees are included in our H&M Incentive Program – HIP. You can read more about our H&M Incentive Program here.
   

  

 In addition to our global benefits, all our local markets offer different competitive perks and benefits. Please note that they may differ between employment type and countries.
   

  

**Inclusion & Diversity**
 At H&M Group, we’re determined to create and maintain inclusive, diverse and equitable workplaces throughout our organisation. Our teams should consist of a variety of people that share and combine their knowledge, experience and ideas. Having a diverse workforce leads to a positive impact on how we address challenges, on what we perceive possible and on how we choose to relate to our colleagues and customers all over the world. Hence all diversity dimensions are taken into consideration in our recruitment process.
   

  

 We strive to have a fair and equal process and therefore kindly ask you not to attach a cover letter in your application as they often contain information that easily can trigger unintentional biases.
   

  

**Company Description**
 H&M Group is a family of brands; H&M, COS, Weekday, Monki, H&M HOME, & Other Stories, ARKET and Afound. At H&M Group, our people are the driving force behind our commitment to creating meaningful growth and more sustainable lifestyles. Help us re-imagine fashion and together we will re-shape our industry. Learn more about H&M Group here.

title: Open Application
description:
We are always looking for talented people to join our team. Unlock your future and join us in the Software Asset Management transformation!
   

  

 We believe that investing in our employees is crucial to reach our goals. That's why we encourage you to apply for this Open Application, since we provide a wide range of opportunities for all kinds of roles, both entry-level and for experienced professionals.
   

  

 Xensam is not just hiring employees; we're building a community of individuals who resonate with our core values – rebellious, humane, and harmony. Embrace your rebellious spirit, find support in a humane environment, and experience the harmonious blend of work and life. We believe in fostering an inclusive and diverse workplace where all individuals are valued, respected, and empowered to be themselves.
   

  

 If you are interested to join the party, please send in your spontanous application here! Attach your resume and let us know what kind of role you would be interested in and why you would like to work at Xensam. Express your interest in the area that aligns with your experiences and skills.
   

  

**Qualifications To Work At Xensam**
* Dynamic individual with a rebellious spirit and innovative mind
* Highly organized and proactive in initiating creative solutions
* Enthusiastic about collaborating with a diverse, driven team
* Strong problem-solving mindset


**What You Get At Xensam**
* A dynamic position embracing "freedom under responsibility".
* Three days in-office (with remote work on Mondays and Fridays).
* If sales targets are met, all employees enjoy an annual destination trip.
* Join an ambitious and diverse team, and work with cutting-edge technology in the fastest-growing SAM software on the market.
* An opportunity to shape your career growth while contributing to the company’s success.
* More benefits depending on location.


**At Xensam, Our Core Values Define Our Culture**
**Rebellious** 
 : We encourage a spirit of freedom and initiative within responsibility.
   

  

**Humane** 
 : We foster a caring, inclusive environment that values diversity and respects individuality.
   

  

**Harmonious** 
 : We promote work-life balance, creating a pleasant, supportive workplace.
   

  

 Join our Open Application process and become a valued member of our candidate pool! We regularly review all applications, and if a position matches your skills and interests, we’ll be excited to reach out to you.
   

  

 Don’t forget to "connect" and follow us on LinkedIn to stay in the loop about new opportunities and the latest happenings at Xensam!
   

  

 Xensam is the leading provider of AI-powered Software Asset Management technology. Designed to provide SAM Managers and IT Leaders with valuable data, our platform offers a wealth of features to simplify SAM workloads with built-in automation and advanced functionality. We prioritize ease of use and industry-leading security for both On-premise and Cloud software, putting organizations in total control of their hybrid IT environments.

title: H&M Summer Internship – Software Engineering
description:
****Company Description****
 Curious about what it’s like to work with technology at H&M? Are you eager to get hands-on experience and turn your theoretical knowledge into practical skills? If you are intrigued by how one of the world’s largest fashion brands operates and how technology drives innovation, then this opportunity is for you!
   

  

 As a Software Engineering Intern at H&M Business Tech, you will spend 10 weeks gaining real-world experience while working on live projects within our software engineering teams. You will work alongside experienced engineers and tech experts, contributing to applications, central tools for tech governance, and business-critical solutions. Additionally, this internship provides an excellent networking opportunity, allowing you to collaborate with colleagues across the company and connect with interns from other programs to explore the versatility of our business.
   

  

 During the internship, you will be paired with a mentor who will play a key role in your learning journey, offering guidance, support, and training opportunities. You will also have a network of experienced colleagues ready to help you develop your technical skills and deepen your understanding of software development in a global fashion-tech company.
   

  

 This is your chance to launch a stellar career and help us transform the fashion world. Let’s shape the future together!
   

  

****Job Description****
**What you’ll be doing:**
 As a Software Engineering Intern, your experience will be a mix of hands-on development work, mentorship, and structured learning opportunities. You will:
   

  

* Contribute to real projects – Help design, develop, test, and maintain high-quality software solutions
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams – Work with engineers, data scientists, and designers to build innovative tech products
* Learn from experienced engineers – Participate in code reviews, troubleshooting, and debugging sessions
* Gain exposure to modern development tools – Work with agile methodologies, cloud platforms, and industry-standard tools
* Explore new technologies – Stay up to date with emerging trends and best practices in software engineering


**What you’ll be learning:**
 Throughout the internship, you’ll be given opportunities to:
   

  

* Gain hands-on experience working with multi - cloud environment (Azure & GCP), and improve your coding skills (we work with programming languages such as JavaScript, Python, Go/Golang, YAML, Java and .NET)
* Develop problem-solving skills through real-world challenges and collaboration with your team
* Learn internal tools and best practices, including version control (Git), CI/CD pipelines, automating and streamlining the software development lifecycle
* Receive structured learning opportunities, including relevant training sessions on modern software practices and industry tools
* Enhance your professional development with mentorship and career-building guidance from experienced tech leaders


****Qualifications****
 To be successful in the role, we believe that you:
   

  

* Are currently enrolled in a university program (e.g., Computer Science, Engineering, or related field) in the later stages of your academic career and will have coursework remaining after completing this internship (preferably 2nd year of Bachelor’s or 1st year of Master’s)
* Have basic knowledge of software development principles, algorithms, and data structures
* Have experience with one or more programming languages (Java, .NET, Python, JavaScript, etc.)
* Are familiar with version control systems (Git, GitHub)
* A curious problem-solver eager to learn and grow in a fast-paced environment
* Are fluent in English, both written and verbal and with excellent communication skills


****Additional Information****
 This is a full-time internship located in Stockholm. We are looking for someone to start from 17th June for 10 weeks.
   

  

**Good to know – Application & Practical Information**
 Excited to join us? Then please get in touch. The last day to apply is 2nd of March. Due to GDPR we can only handle applications via our career site. Send us your application in English including a resume and proof of education.
   

  

 We strive to have a fair and equal process and therefore kindly ask you not to attach a cover letter in your application as they often contain information that easily can trigger unintentional biases.
   

  

****Benefits****
 This is a paid internship program, meaning you will work full-time and receive a market-based salary. Other H&M Group benefits will be shared later in the process. This position requires a valid permit to live and work in Sweden.
   

  

**Recruitment Process & Timeline**
 When you apply for a Software Engineer internship role, we will have the following steps in the process:
   

  

* Screening questions: when you apply, you will be asked to answer a few short questions to assess your eligibility for the role.
* Online assessment: you will be asked to complete an online analytical assessment, between 3-7th March.
* Virtual Assessment Center: if successful, you will be invited to a one-day assessment center, taking place between 18-25th March.
* Final decision: our goal is to be able to let you know the outcome of the assessment center before 6th April.


**Inclusion & Diversity**
*H&M is a part of H&M Group. At H&M Group, we’re determined to create and maintain inclusive, diverse and equitable workplaces throughout our organisation. Our teams should consist of a variety of people that share and combine their knowledge, experience and ideas. Having a diverse workforce leads to a positive impact on how we address challenges, on what we perceive possible and on how we choose to relate to our colleagues and customers all over the world. Hence all diversity dimensions are taken into consideration in our recruitment process.*
****Company Description****
 H&M Group is a family of brands; H&M, COS, Weekday, Monki, H&M HOME, & Other Stories, ARKET and Afound. At H&M Group, our people are the driving force behind our commitment to creating meaningful growth and more sustainable lifestyles. Help us re-imagine fashion and together we will re-shape our industry. Learn more about H&M Group here.

title: Solutions Architect
description:
We are seeking an experienced
 **Solution Architect** 
 to lead the design and transformation of our global network infrastructure. As part of our team, you will work on delivering a cloud-based, service-layer network, focusing on automation, cost efficiency, and enhanced user experience across all locations.
 



  





**Key Responsibilities:** 



* Lead design efforts for new network solutions supporting business initiatives.
* Transform legacy network into a code-driven, service-layer architecture.
* Ensure architectural policies and guidelines align with business needs and roadmaps.
* Collaborate with stakeholders to meet business requirements and drive network innovations.
* Stay updated with industry trends, making recommendations for continuous improvement.
* Contribute to the strategy and OKRs for network domains.



**Qualifications:** 



* Extensive experience in
 **Network Design** 
 and
 **Architecture** 
 (including WAN, SD-WAN, Routing, Switching).
* Expertise in
 **Cloud Networking** 
 ,
 **Network Security** 
 , and
 **Network Automation** 
 (Python, Ansible, Git).
* Hands-on experience with
 **Cisco/Aruba** 
 environments and technologies like
 **BGP** 
 ,
 **MP-BGP** 
 ,
 **IPSec** 
 ,
 **802.1x** 
 .
* Strong problem-solving and analytical skills, with the ability to translate business needs into network solutions.
* Experience with
 **Micro Segmentation** 
 ,
 **SD-LAN** 
 , and
 **Network APIs/Integrations** 
 .

title: Senior Product Manager
description:
**Introduction**
**Would you like to shape the future technology used by eCommerce businesses and consumers across Europe? Do you have experience with B2B SaaS product management and know what it takes to create valuable products for customers that drive business results?**
 Then you might be the person we are looking for!
   

  

 FactFinder is the European leader in product discovery and search. Hundreds of eCommerce stores use our AI-powered technology to help create a great purchasing experience and improve their revenue. To strengthen our team we are looking for an experienced self-driven senior product manager who would like to make a difference for our customers.
   

  

 You will be based at our Stockholm office and together with the Product and Development teams you will discover new product opportunities, shape the product roadmap, and bring product features from idea to value creation for our customers. At FactFinder we value diversity and inclusion and you will work in a hybrid environment with colleagues from all around Europe.
   

  

**Your mission**
* Discover new product opportunities based on product data, customer feedback, market and competitive insights
* Conceptualise features and bring them from development to value creation for our customers
* Detail requirements and manage the product development process to ensure progress toward goals
* Work closely with the development team to achieve the goals together
* Work with customers to test new product features and understand their main challenges and opportunities for feature improvements
* Plan product releases and launches in collaboration with Marketing and facilitate the creation of launch material and documentation
* Train the Operations, Marketing, and Sales organisation in new products and features


**Your profile**
* 5+ years of experience as a Product Manager preferably in B2B SaaS
* Technical background and strong business acumen
* Previously working with eCommerce tech and experience with AI is beneficial
* Mission-driven; doing what it takes to achieve our goals and willing to handle and solve problems also if it falls out of formal responsibility
* A collaborative team player that nurtures the best ideas and arguments
* Caring about the customer above all and being their voice across the organization and the development team
* Responsible finisher that makes sure aspects to create customer value through product development are handled
* High proficiency in English language


**THE JOY OF WORKING WITH US**
* Scale-up company with a market-leading product
* Open culture with diverse international teams
* Flexible working hours
* Personal development support, e.g. access to the learning platform Udemy
* Regular feedback rounds


**Job Location**
 Stockholm
   

  

**About Us**
 FactFinder is the European leader in eCommerce product discovery and search. Using authentic intelligence, the unique combination of artificial and human intelligence, FactFinder understands every shopper’s intent from the first click – increasing conversions and boosting revenues by over 30%.
   

  

 For over two decades, FactFinder has been trusted to support billions of search queries a year, for thousands of B2B and B2C brands including Intersport, White Stuff, OBI, Stihl, and MyTheresa. FactFinder is headquartered in Germany, with offices in Berlin, London and Stockholm. Visit www.fact-finder.com for more information.

title: Supporttekniker IT
description:
*Vi på Iver ger samma löfte till våra kollegor som till våra kunder. Löftet är att alltid vara ”beside you”, ”behind you” och ”before you”. Vi kallar det för ”The Iver way”.
   

  

 Nu söker vi en
 **Supporttekniker IT** 
 som vill bli en del av Iver och som vill vara med och bidra till bättre IT-lösningar som gör skillnad för våra kunder! Är du vår nya kollega?*
**Din roll på Iver?**
 Du arbetar som del i Ivers affärsområde Bank & Fintech med ansvar för tjänsteleverans av kritisk kundinfrastruktur. Våra kunder är ofta stora nordiska företag inom bank och finans eller myndigheter, med krav på hög nivå av informationssäkerhet och infrastruktur som kod. Vissa av dem utgör samhällskritisk verksamhet och/eller har en särskild hotbild.
   

  

 Du arbetar i vår Technical Assistance Center med ansvar för Ivers tjänsteleverans, så som infrastruktur, system- och applikationsdrift, användarnära tjänster och cybersäkerhetstjänster. Du arbetar strukturerat och är van att planera ditt arbete samt är mycket noggrann i det du gör och gillar att arbeta i team.
   

  

**Exempel På Dagliga Arbetsuppgifter**
* Utförande av Service Requester: exempel är uppsättning av servrar, ändring av konfiguration samt server-, system- och kontoadministration
* Monitorering av olika system i drift
* Dokumentation
* Kundkontakt via telefon och i ärenden
* Ärendehantering


**Vad erbjuder vi dig?**
**Iver - Where technology meets business.** 
 Hos Iver får du möjlighet att arbeta med den senaste tekniken och vara med på en spännande tillväxtresa. Iver är ett bolag med entreprenöriella rötter och en kultur som präglas av flexibilitet och samarbete. Vårt mål är att våra kunder – här i Norden och internationellt – ska se oss som en ledande partner för digital transformation.
   

  

 På Iver är vi inkluderande och strävar efter genuint samarbete där vi arbetar mot gemensamma mål. Inom Iver finns stora möjligheter till utveckling och vi står bakom dig när du vill lära dig mer – inom ditt specialområde, ledarskap eller nya områden.
   

  

 Hos Iver är du också en del av ett ambitiöst och innovativt företag, vilket innebär att förbättra, testa, utvärdera och våga ändra hur vi gör saker är viktiga ingredienser och vi är övertygade om att det är så vi utvecklas.
 **We’re not big blue. We’re yellow.** 
 Stora nog att skala och agila nog att innovera.
   

  

**Vem söker vi?**
**För att lyckas i rollen vill vi att du har kunskaper inom:**
* För tjänsten relevant eftergymnasial utbildning
* Ca 1-2 års arbetslivserfarenhet inom IT
* Erfarenhet av arbete på en teknisk Servicedesk, NOC, driftavdelning eller liknande med erfarenhet av ITIL-baserade ärendehanteringssystem
* God erfarenhet av Windowsmiljöer inklusive Active Directory, AAD, Windows Server med mera
* Förståelse och medvetenhet inom tekniskt och processmässigt informationssäkerhetsarbete
* Övervakning och datavisualisering med exempelvis Zabbix, Prometheus och Grafana/Kibana
* Grundläggande kunskaper inom nätverk och brandvägg
* Du talar och skriver såväl svenska som engelska obehindrat


**Meriterande Kunskaper**
* Erfarenhet av Linuxmiljöer
* Erfarenhet av switching- och routingprotokoll samt virtualiseringsmiljöer
* Erfarenhet av klienthantering med exempelvis Intune och Configuration Manager
* Vana av produktionsmiljöer med särskilda krav på informationssäkerhet
* Erfarenhet av NGFW, lastbalansering, WAF med mera


 För den här tjänsten ställer vi höga krav på IT-säkerhet vilket innebär att vi kommer göra bakgrundskontroller som en del av rekryteringsprocessen. Utöver det är det krav på svenskt medborgarskap.
   

  

**Placeringsort**
 Vi finns på 26 kontor runt om i Sverige och Norge. Placeringsort för denna roll är på vårt kontor i Solna.
   

  

**Sök till oss!**
 Urval sker löpande, tjänsten kan tillsättas före sista ansökningsdag. Iver eftersträvar en jämn könsfördelning och värdesätter etnisk och kulturell mångfald. Önskad start är snarast eller enligt överenskommelse. Du är välkommen att kontakta Maria Skoglund-Robertsson (maria.skoglund-robertsson@iver.se) vid frågor eller funderingar kring tjänsten.
   

  

 Vi ser fram emot din ansökan!
   

  

**We empower our Nordic society** 
 . Iver är en ledande nordisk helhetsleverantör av molnbaserade IT-tjänster med spetskompetens inom drift, cybersäkerhet, cloud och innovation.
   

  

**Våra tjänster är kritiska inte bara för våra kunder – utan för digitaliseringen av samhället i stort.** 
 Vi säkerställer att sjukvården har tillgång till rätt patientdata, att samhällskritiska system aldrig ligger nere och att flygplanen landar säkert. Som en lyhörd och affärsnära helhetspartner möjliggör vi våra kunders innovation – idag och imorgon.

title: Solution Architect - Fulfillment Area (SAP)
description:
**Job Description**
**This is opportunity to join team of Solution Architects working on cutting edge retail solutions within our company within several different areas from product creation, through logistics, to sales in store or online.**
 As a Solution Architect for Portfolio Brands, you will work with stakeholders in different Brands in the Group and play a critical role in driving growth, profitability, and scalability across both digital and retail domains. This position requires a strategic thinker with a deep understanding of technology solutions and their application in the fashion retail industry.
   

  

 In this role as Solution Architect, you will be responsible for translating business and tech requirements into architecture blueprints. You will also conduct thorough analysis of existing solutions, identify gaps, and recommend improvements. To deliver in this role you will have to evaluate the architecture holistically, use deep technical expertise to understand the business impact of technical components, and give recommendations and guidelines for teams implementing solutions.
   

  

 You want work in a fast-paced, dynamic environment and open to change. You show commitment and ownership and demonstrate attention to detail and accuracy, architectural governance and standards. Effective team player that can express the importance of technical concepts and quality, emerging technologies, ideas, feelings, opinions, and conclusions to peers and people with an only limited technical background and contribute positively to your team environment.
   

  

 We are looking for a Solution Architect for
 ***Fulfillment***
 Area.
   

  

**Responsibilities**
* Define a shared technical and architectural vision focused on creating technical alignment for the full solution rather than concerns for specific components.
* Review, analyze, develop and facilitate stakeholder understanding of business and technology implication of future direction, roadmaps and implementation plans.
* Create architectural design to guide and contextualize solution development across initiatives that aligns with business and IT goals.
* Provide necessary leadership, analysis and design tasks related to the development of technology solutions to ensure that solutions meet business needs and align with architectural governance and standards.
* Identify interdependencies and use ‘holistic thinking’ to ensure the cross-team perspective. Provide consulting support around solution architecture to teams to ensure a product is aligned with the overall enterprise architecture.
* Translate business and technical requirements into architectural blueprints and document all solution architecture design and analysis.
* Evaluate and drive continuous improvement, reducing technical debt, and enhancing end-to-end business value.
* Work continuously with incorporating broader aspects such as overall product costs/revenue, data privacy & sovereignty, business continuity, information security, integration with other systems, etc.
* Facilitate best practice sharing and teach architecture thinking to engineering and product community.
* Take ownership and responsibility of current solutions and flows and ensure secure and stable operations with good focus on resolving recurring problems to the root cause.


**Qualifications**
* Minimum of 5 years of experience in IT with experience in Solution architecture in the retail or fashion industry.
* Proven track record in designing and implementing scalable solutions in digital and retail environments.
* Experience in working with SAP, Salesforce etc.
* Experience in working in complex landscape with a combination of cloud solution and Enterprise Applications such as SAP.
* Strong understanding of cloud computing, microservices architecture, APIs, and integration frameworks.
* Ability to understand and visualize concepts that are not yet concrete, and use your problem-solving skills, strong analytic ability, creativity and customer and business drive to find a solution.
* Ability to create both high-level and low-level design documentation and technical specification.
* Experience of planning and driving workshops with implementation teams, architects as well as business stakeholders.
* Ability to work with composability frameworks and support to define Packaged Business Capabilities (PBCs) to ensure scalable and modular architectural solutions.
* Excellent communication, presentation, and interpersonal skills.
* Strong analytical and problem-solving abilities.


**Benefits**
**Additional Information**
 We offer all our employees at H&M Group attractive benefits with extensive development opportunities around the globe. All our employees receive a staff discount card, usable on all our H&M Group brands in stores and online. Brands covered by the discount are H&M (Beauty and Move included), COS, Weekday, Monki, H&M HOME, & Other Stories, ARKET, Afound. In addition to our staff discount, all our employees are included in our H&M Incentive Program – HIP. You can read more about our H&M Incentive Program here.
   

  

*In addition to our global benefits, all our local markets offer different competitive perks and benefits. Please note that they may differ between employment type and countries.*
**Inclusion & Diversity**
*H&M is a part of H&M Group. At H&M Group, we’re determined to create and maintain inclusive, diverse and equitable workplaces throughout our organisation. Our teams should consist of a variety of people that share and combine their knowledge, experience and ideas. Having a diverse workforce leads to a positive impact on how we address challenges, on what we perceive possible and on how we choose to relate to our colleagues and customers all over the world. Hence all diversity dimensions are taken into consideration in our recruitment process.*
*We are committed to a recruitment process that is fair, equitable, and based on competency. We therefore kindly ask you to not attach a cover letter in your application.*
**Company Description**
 H&M is a fashion brand that offers the latest styles and inspiration, from fashion pieces and unique designer collaborations to affordable wardrobe essentials. Our business idea is fashion & quality at the best price in a sustainable way. Learn more about H&M here.

title: Engineering Manager Data Platform
description:
At EasyPark, we love cities. We love them for work, for play and everything in between. That’s why our vision is to make cities more livable! EasyPark Group is a global company and a true leader in its domain. There is a clear ambition to quickly grow in coverage and offer our services to more customers and partners.
   

  

 This is an exciting opportunity to become part of the EasyPark team as Engineering Manager for the data platform team. In this role you’ll oversee the team’s people, processes, delivery and drive the data platform evolution and collaborate with customer teams and stakeholders.
   

  

**The role**
 As the Engineering Manager for our data platform team, you will lead a distributed team of data engineers dedicated to building and scaling our global data platform. We believe in lean and agile principles, where team members feel and exercise ownership and responsibility to navigate toward goals and achieve their mission.
   

  

 Your role will include: refining the team’s delivery processes and operational maturity, engaging with internal customers and stakeholders across the company to build, prioritize and communicate the team’s roadmap. Your experience in crafting technical platforms in other organizations will bring valuable insights, while your open-mindedness will help shape our approach to data overall.
   

  

**You will contribute & make an impact through the following:**
* Lead and grow a distributed high-performing team by providing mentorship, coaching, and technical guidance while fostering a culture of collaboration, trust, and continuous improvement.
* Contributing to and promoting a healthy and agile software development culture with sustainable delivery
* Together with the team, shape the vision for the data platform’s future, aligned with business priorities and technical goals. You inspire the team to innovate and successfully bring that vision to life. You communicate and evangelize that vision and the roadmap to achieve it
* Taking on responsibility for the team’s delivery, and the technical health of the data platform as well as its architectural evolution


**About You**
* You bring experience as a leader of an agile development team with great talent, ideally in the infrastructure and platform development areas
* You have a passion for continuous learning and improvement
* You are a great communicator, with excellent interpersonal and leadership skills
* You enjoy leading change in a fast-growing and scaling company
* You have interest in / expertise in modern cloud-based data warehouses and data modeling and governance practices


 This role is based at the EasyPark headquarters in Stockholm/ Sweden, and we expect you to be in the office at least a couple of days a week. Fluency in English is required for this position (Swedish is not needed).
   

  

**Life at EasyPark**
 We are a values-driven company with an international culture and a global presence. By providing an environment with space to grow and room for autonomy, we believe in encouraging and supporting our team members to take initiative and act outside of their comfort zone. To have an open mind and embrace change is a part of our DNA. At EasyPark we are dedicated to maintaining an open culture where the voice of each person is heard, and we play as one team across the globe. Diversity is something we celebrate and we are committed to creating an inclusive environment for everyone.
   

  

**Some of the perks of joining the EasyPark team**
* Flexible ways of working: combine working from home with working from the office, whatever is agreed on within your team.
* Digital global onboarding: three days to indulge in learning & connecting with fellow new starters across the globe.
* Office environment: an open and colorful office environment in the city center + free coffee, fruit and of course… a ping pong table.
* Proactive health support: your well-being is important to us, why we offer proactive medical support, all depending on your need.
* Virtual coffee chats: join the internal Slack channel & randomly connect with a new EasyParker across the globe each week: take a break, have a chat & spark that cross-collaboration
* Work for an award-winning company: for three years in a row (2019, -20, -21) EasyPark was awarded Sweden’s Best Managed Companies by Deloitte.
* Pension, insurances & health reimbursement: Of course we have the basics in place, and encourage everyone an active & healthy lifestyle, by putting your reimbursement to use for physical activities.

title: Solution Architect
description:
We’re a cutting-edge tech-enabled bank on a mission to revolutionize financing for small businesses across 7 markets in northern Europe. Our innovative solutions aim to simplify access to financing and enable growth for small businesses. As we scale, we are now looking for a Solution Architect to be part of our journey to transform the financial landscape for entrepreneurs.
 



  





  





**About the role** 




 As a Solution Architect at Qred, you’ll be a part of a growing tech organization, supporting our cross-functional teams in our Revenue Domain and ensuring they can deliver in the best possible way. You will both advise & collaborate with teams on solutions in their discovery phase and own problems yourself from planning to implementation. Your daily work will probably include the following
 



  




* Supporting product teams in the Revenue Domain in their ability to build cloud-distributed systems, serverless architectures and container platforms
* Working with with internal and external stakeholders to identify the company's needs and requirements and translate them into technical solutions
* Working across teams on solutions that involve multiple teams and ensuring the solutions we build are in line with our technical vision
* Getting ownership of problems to solve regarding products, architecture, and way of working impacting multiple product teams
* Participating in setting our technical roadmap to align with business goals and the problems we see in our organization & architecture
* Designing and implementing scalable, reliable, and secure solutions



  





  





**Requirements** 



* At least 5 years of hands-on experience in development with Java or NodeJS/TypeScript
* A strong background in software development and cloud infrastructure
* Strong experience with building new solutions from the ground up
* Good grasp of security and compliance standards
* Experience with any cloud provider (a plus if you know AWS)
* Great communication skills, with the ability to present complex concepts to both technical and non-technical stakeholders
* Familiarity with monitoring and logging tools such as AWS CloudWatch, Grafana or ELK Stack



  





**Why join us?** 




 This is a unique opportunity to join a growing fintech company that is redefining financial services for small businesses in Northern Europe. You’ll work with a passionate and innovative team, participating in creating an environment where employees thrive and contribute to a shared vision of success.
 



  





**One last thing** 




 This is a full-time, permanent position based in Stockholm. Don’t wait to send in your application, we are reviewing applications on a rolling basis. While the start date is flexible, the right candidate can join us immediately.
 



  





  





*Qred celebrates diversity and does not discriminate based on ethnicity, religion, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, disability status, or any other applicable characteristics protected by law.*

title: Sales Engineer
description:
**About the role** 

 As a 
 
 Sales Engineer
 
  at Voyado, you'll step into an exciting role at the intersection of technology, sales, and strategy. Supporting our 
 **Engage** 
  product, you’ll combine technical expertise with commercial acumen to drive our sales efforts. You’ll play a pivotal role in understanding customer needs, delivering compelling product demonstrations, and tailoring solutions that address client challenges.
 



 If you thrive on blending tech-savvy insights with commercial problem-solving, this is your chance to shine!
 


**What you'll be up to** 
* Collaborate with the sales team to identify customer needs and deliver tailored technical solutions.
* Conduct in-depth product demonstrations and technical presentations to showcase the capabilities of Voyado Engage.
* Address technical challenges, customizing solutions to ensure alignment with client requirements.
* Act as a bridge between sales and product teams, translating technical details into clear business benefits.
* Stay updated on product enhancements, industry trends, and the competitive landscape.


**About you** 

 We’re looking for a dynamic professional ready to take the next step in your career. Ideally, you have a technical background and a business-oriented mindset, enjoy problem-solving, thrive in a collaborative environment, and have a knack for translating complex technical details into compelling value propositions.
 



*What We’re Looking For:* 



* Proven experience as a Sales Engineer, Solution Engineer, or a technical customer-facing role, such as working with implementing a SaaS Solution.
* Background working with complex digital products, preferably SaaS solutions.
* Good communication and presentation skills, with the ability to simplify and engage.
* Creative problem-solving skills to address diverse customer needs.
* A team player who values collective success and collaboration.
* Motivated by the challenge of entering new markets and driving growth.
* Experience with CRM systems in the e-commerce industry is highly meritorious (experience with Voyado Engage is a strong plus).

title: Mid-Senior Full Stack Engineer
description:
**About Sinch**
 Sinch is pioneering the way the world communicates. More than 150,000 businesses — including Google, Uber, Paypal, Visa, Tinder, and many others — rely on Sinch's Customer Communications Cloud to power engaging customer experiences through mobile messaging, voice, and email.
   

  

 Whether you need to verify users or craft omnichannel campaigns, Sinch makes it easy. Our AI-infused Super Network, APIs, and applications ensure you can connect with your customers reliably and securely, at every step of their journey.
   

  

 At Sinch we "Dream Big", "Win Together", "Keep it simple", and "Make it Happen". These values are our foundation!
   

  

**Description**
 Develop, architect and scale the core infrastructure for Sinch's web applications. Be part of in a small cross functional team that sets its own objectives and goals with responsibility for every stage of product development life cycle from planning and design to implementation, testing, deployment, monitoring and maintenance, you build It you run it.
   

  

 Your work will be focused around the common platform used to that makes up the core of the product line; The code you write will be consumed by used by many different teams and is a key enabler in the product line. You will solve problems across the enterprise, focusing not only on how to deliver a great product today but setting the foundations for the future.
   

  

**Tech Stack:** 
 NodeJS, Java, React, Typescript
   

  

**Requirements**
* A strong software engineering background
* In-depth knowledge of the web platform and ecosystem
* Expertise in modern front-end technologies.
* Solid track record working with Typescript in a professional or open-source setting.
* Experience building services on the backend
* Fluency in English


**Good to have**
* Experience using design systems
* Experience making architectural decisions that have high impact
* Experience with Web components and the latest Web APIs
* Experience with AWS, Kubernetes and other cloud native technologies


**Our Hiring Process**
 We are committed to ensuring a recruitment process that is fair, objective, consistent, and inclusive. Our approach includes structured, competency-based interviews designed to evaluate your skills, experience, and qualifications relevant to the role. At times, we may include a data-driven assessment to enhance our hiring success and identify candidates likely to excel.
   

  

 We believe in a two-way process and encourage you to ask questions throughout the journey. If this role isn't what you're looking for, please explore the other opportunities listed on our career page: https://www.sinch.com/careers/. No matter who you are, we hope you find an exciting path forward - hopefully with us!

title: Regional Sales Director - Nordics
description:
Ajax Systems is an international technological company and Europe's largest security system manufacturer. In addition, the company offers solutions for video surveillance, smart homes, fire detection, and flood prevention. The product portfolio includes 180 wireless and wired devices for security and automation. Today, Ajax protects over 3.5 million users in 187 countries worldwide. The company employs 4,100 specialists.
   

  

 We develop local teams because we understand local experts best comprehend market specifics. The company has sales representatives worldwide, including Italy, Spain, Germany, France, the United Kingdom, the USA, Australia, South Africa and other regions. The Global Business Development team is like-minded people who share the ambitious goals of Ajax Systems.
   

  

 The best software combined with powerful hardware has forever changed the perception of security systems for users and industry professionals. Being recognized at the biggest specialized exhibitions such as IFSEC, Expoprotection and Intersec, as well as winning prestigious awards from industry-leading media like PSI magazine and GIT SECURITY, today Ajax is one of the most awarded security systems in Europe.
   

  

 Ajax Systems' production includes three factories, two of which are located in Ukraine and one in Turkey. At the same time, the company's certification according to the ISO 14001 standard ensures a minimal impact of production on the environment. The selection of components for Ajax device manufacturing is determined by the presence of manufacturer declarations confirming compliance with RoHS requirements.
   

  

 The company emerged against the backdrop of revolution and war. That's why resilience is the cornerstone of the brand's DNA, and the fight against evil by creating the best security and automation devices is Ajax's unwavering mission.
   

  

 Ajax Systems is a Ukrainian success story, a place of incredible strength and energy.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities:**
* Achieve sales objectives in the region
* Develop and execute a comprehensive business strategy aligned with the company's overall goals
* Lead the local team to achieve and exceed sales targets, ensuring market share growth
* Establish and report on metrics to measure team performance; correct deficiencies where necessary
* Recruit, train, and mentor a high-performing team
* Foster a positive and collaborative work environment that encourages innovation and creativity
* Identify and pursue new business opportunities, partnerships, and markets
* Establish and nurture strong relationships with key clients and industry stakeholders


**What We’re Looking For:**
* Proven experience in a senior management role covering Nordics, as a Regional Sales Director / Head of Sales / Country Manager or a Sales Director ideally in a fast-growing international company in the security industry
* Experience hiring and leading a successful sales team.
* Strong knowledge of the Nordic market and an established network of industry contacts
* Experience in managing distributor and channel sales
* Proven track record of exceeding sales targets and driving business growth
* Strong negotiation and relationship-building skills
* Ability to work independently and adapt to a fast-paced environment
* Fluency in at least one Nordic language (Swedish, Danish, Norwegian, or Finnish)
* Results-oriented nature and ability to show initiative and responsibility for own results
* Highly motivated with the ability to make things happen
* Well-presented, professional, reliable, and ethical personality


**We offer:**
* Competitive compensation that includes a base salary and performance-related commissions
* Company car / car allowance
* All necessary business expenses covered (travel, phone, laptop, etc.)
* Opportunity to work with a cutting-edge product in a rapidly growing company
* Career growth opportunities within an international team


 We are looking for a highly motivated
 **Regional Sales Director** 
 to lead our sales operations across the Nordic region. In this role, you will be responsible for driving business growth, managing key customer relationships, and expanding our market presence. You will work closely with distributors, system integrators, and key accounts to develop and execute sales strategies.
   

  

 This is a unique opportunity to join a fast-growing company with a strong product portfolio and an ambitious vision for the security industry.

title: Senior Information Security Consultant
description:
**Vill du vara med och bygga ett marknadsledande team inom informationssäkerhet?**
 Nu har du en unik möjlighet att kliva in i en helt ny roll som
 **Senior Information Security Consultant** 
 och bli en del av
 **Cyberdefense at Iver** 
 .
   

  

 Cyberdefense at Iver är den del av Iver som arbetar med utveckling och leverans av avancerade offensiva och defensiva cybersäkerhetstjänster.
   

  

 Vi söker erfarna konsulter som vill vara med och förstärka vår förmåga inom informationssäkerhet, driva utvecklingen inom området och spela en nyckelroll i vår spännande transformationsresa.
   

  

**Om Iver**
 Iver är en ledande nordisk helhetsleverantör av molnbaserade IT-tjänster med spetskompetens inom drift, cybersäkerhet, cloud och innovation. Våra tjänster är kritiska inte bara för våra kunder – utan för digitaliseringen av samhället i stort.
   

  

 Med huvudkontor i Stockholm verkar Iver främst i Norden med en agenda att fortsätta expandera. Iver omsätter drygt 3 miljarder SEK och har cirka 1 500 anställda som arbetar på ett av våra 25 kontor i Norden.
   

  

**Din roll på Iver?**
 Som
 **Senior Information Security Consultant** 
 får du chansen att påverka och forma informationssäkerhetsområdet inom vår organisation samt vårt erbjudande mot marknaden. I denna roll arbetar du både strategiskt och operativt, med nära kundkontakt och fokus på att hjälpa Iver och Ivers kunder i deras säkerhetsarbete.
   

  

**Det Här Är En Möjlighet Att**
* Vara med från start och sätta ramarna för hur vi arbetar med informationssäkerhet.
* Ta fram strategier kring tjänster inom informationssäkerhet.
* Delta i en transformationsresa där informationssäkerhet är en central del av vår framgång.
* Bygga långsiktiga relationer med kunder och bidra till deras säkerhetsstrategier.
* Kombinera teknisk expertis med affärsmannaskap och skapa verkligt värde för våra kunder.


**Vad erbjuder vi dig?**
**Iver - We empower our Nordic society.**
 På Iver får du möjlighet att arbeta med den senaste tekniken och vara med på en spännande tillväxtresa. Vi är inkluderande och strävar efter ett genuint samarbete mot gemensamma mål. Inom Iver finns stora möjligheter till utveckling och vi finns här för att inspirera dig till att nå dina yrkesmässiga mål.
